options.description: Package providing the theme. This package will be installedto your profile. If null then the themeis assumed to already be available in your profile.

options.title: gtk.theme.name
options.description: The name of the theme within the package.

options.title: home.enableDebugInfo
options.description: Some Nix packages provide debug symbols forgdb in the debug output.This option ensures that those are automatically fetched fromthe binary cache if available and gdb isconfigured to find those symbols.

options.title: home.enableNixpkgsReleaseCheck
options.description: Determines whether to check for release version mismatch between HomeManager and Nixpkgs. Using mismatched versions is likely to cause errorsand unexpected behavior. It is therefore highly recommended to use arelease of Home Manager that corresponds with your chosen release ofNixpkgs.
options.note: When this option is enabled and a mismatch is detected then a warningwill be printed when the user configuration is being built.

options.title: home.packages
options.description: The set of packages to appear in the user environment.

options.title: home.activation
options.description: The activation scripts blocks to run when activating a HomeManager generation. Any entry here should be idempotent,meaning running twice or more times produces the same resultas running it once.
options.note: If the script block produces any observable side effect, suchas writing or deleting files, then itmust be placed after the specialwriteBoundary script block. Prior to thewrite boundary one can place script blocks that verifies, butdoes not modify, the state of the system and exits if anunexpected state is found. For example, thecheckLinkTargets script block checks forcollisions between non-managed files and files defined inhome.file.

options.title: home.extraOutputsToInstall
options.description: List of additional package outputs of the packageshome.packages that should be installed intothe user environment.

options.title: home.file
options.description: Attribute set of files to link into the user home.

options.title: home.file.<name>.enable
options.description: Whether this file should be generated. This option allows specificfiles to be disabled.

options.title: home.file.<name>.executable
options.description: Set the execute bit. If null, defaults to the modeof the source file or to falsefor files created through the text option.

options.title: home.file.<name>.onChange
options.description: Shell commands to run when file has changed betweengenerations. The script will be runafter the new files have been linkedinto place.
options.note: Note, this code is always run when recursive isenabled.

options.title: home.file.<name>.recursive
options.description: If the file source is a directory, then this optiondetermines whether the directory should be recursivelylinked to the target location. This option has no effectif the source is a file.
options.note: If false (the default) then the targetwill be a symbolic link to the source directory. Iftrue then the target will be adirectory structure matching the source’s but whose leafsare symbolic links to the files of the source directory.

options.title: home.file.<name>.source
options.description: Path of the source file or directory. Ifhome.file.<name>.textis non-null then this option will automatically point to a filecontaining that text.

options.title: home.file.<name>.target
options.description: Path to target file relative to HOME.

options.title: home.file.<name>.text
options.description: Text of the file. If this option is null thenhome.file.<name>.sourcemust be set.

options.title: home.homeDirectory
options.description: The user’s home directory. Must be an absolute path.

options.title: home.keyboard
options.description: Keyboard configuration. Set to null todisable Home Manager keyboard management.

options.title: home.keyboard.layout
options.description: Keyboard layout. If null, then the systemconfiguration will be used.
options.note: This defaults to null for stateversion ≥ 19.09 and "us" otherwise.

options.title: home.keyboard.model
options.description: Keyboard model.

options.title: home.keyboard.options
options.description: X keyboard options; layout switching goes here.

options.title: home.keyboard.variant
options.description: X keyboard variant. If null, then thesystem configuration will be used.
options.note: This defaults to null for stateversion ≥ 19.09 and "" otherwise.

options.title: home.language
options.description: Language configuration.

options.title: home.language.address
options.description: The language to use for addresses.

options.title: home.language.base
options.description: The language to use unless overridden by a more specific option.

options.title: home.language.collate
options.description: The language to use for collation (alphabetical ordering).

options.title: home.language.ctype
options.description: Character classification category.

options.title: home.language.measurement
options.description: The language to use for measurement values.

options.title: home.language.messages
options.description: The language to use for messages, application UI languages, etc.

options.title: home.language.monetary
options.description: The language to use for formatting currencies and money amounts.

options.title: home.language.name
options.description: The language to use for personal names.

options.title: home.language.numeric
options.description: The language to use for numerical values.

options.title: home.language.paper
options.description: The language to use for paper sizes.

options.title: home.language.telephone
options.description: The language to use for telephone numbers.

options.title: home.language.time
options.description: The language to use for formatting times.

options.title: home.pointerCursor
options.description: Cursor configuration. Set to null to disable.
options.note: Top-level options declared under this submodule are backend independentoptions. Options declared under namespaces such as x11are backend specific options. By default, only backend independent cursorconfigurations are generated. If you need configurations for specificbackends, you can toggle them via the enable option. For example,home.pointerCursor.x11.enablewill enable x11 cursor configurations.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.package
options.description: Package providing the cursor theme.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.gtk.enable
options.description: Whether to enable gtk config generation for home.pointerCursor.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.name
options.description: The cursor name within the package.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.size
options.description: The cursor size.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.x11.enable
options.description: Whether to enable x11 config generation for home.pointerCursor.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.x11.defaultCursor
options.description: The default cursor file to use within the package.

options.title: home.profileDirectory
options.description: The profile directory where Home Manager generations are installed.

options.title: home.sessionPath
options.description: Extra directories to add to PATH.
options.note: These directories are added to the PATH variable in adouble-quoted context, so expressions like $HOME areexpanded by the shell. However, since expressions like ~ or* are escaped, they will end up in the PATHverbatim.

options.title: home.sessionVariables
options.description: Environment variables to always set at login.
options.note: The values may refer to other environment variables usingPOSIX.2 style variable references. For example, a variableparameter may be referenced as$parameter or ${parameter}. Adefault value foo may be given as per${parameter:-foo} and, similarly, an alternatevalue bar can be given as per${parameter:+bar}.
options.type: lazy attribute set of (string or path or signed integer or floating point number)

options.title: home.shellAliases
options.description: An attribute set that maps aliases (the top level attribute namesin this option) to command strings or directly to build outputs.
options.note: This option should only be used to manage simple aliases that arecompatible across all shells. If you need to use a shell specificfeature then make sure to use a shell specific option, for exampleprograms.bash.shellAliases for Bash.

options.title: home.stateVersion
options.description: It is occasionally necessary for Home Manager to changeconfiguration defaults in a way that is incompatible withstateful data. This could, for example, include switching thedefault data format or location of a file.
options.note: The state version indicates which defaultsettings are in effect and will therefore help avoid breakingprogram configurations. Switching to a higher state versiontypically requires performing some manual steps, such as dataconversion or moving files.

options.title: home.username
options.description: The user’s username.

options.title: i18n.glibcLocales
options.description: Customized glibcLocales package providingthe LOCALE_ARCHIVE_* environment variable.
options.note: This option only applies to the Linux platform.

options.title: i18n.inputMethod.enabled
options.description: Select the enabled input method. Input methods are software to inputsymbols that are not available on standard input devices.
options.note: Input methods are especially used to input Chinese, Japanese andKorean characters.

options.description: A customizable lightweight input method.The next generation of fcitx.Addons (including engines, dictionaries, skins) can be added usingi18n.inputMethod.fcitx5.addons.
A Korean input method based on XIM. Nabi doesn’t support Qt 5.
The “universal input method” is a library with an XIM bridge.uim mainly supports Chinese, Japanese and Korean.
An extremely easy-to-use input method framework.
A Korean IME.

options.title: i18n.inputMethod.fcitx5.addons
options.description: Enabled Fcitx5 addons.

options.title: i18n.inputMethod.kime.config
options.description: kime configuration. Refer tohttps://github.com/Riey/kime/blob/develop/docs/CONFIGURATION.mdfor details on supported values.
options.example: {  daemon = {    modules = ["Xim" "Indicator"];  };  indicator = {    icon_color = "White";  };  engine = {    hangul = {      layout = "dubeolsik";    };  };}

options.title: i18n.inputMethod.uim.toolbar
options.description: Selected UIM toolbar.

options.title: launchd.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Home Manager to define per-user daemons by making useof launchd’s LaunchAgents.

options.title: launchd.agents
options.description: Define LaunchAgents.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.enable
options.description: Whether to enable ‹name›.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config
options.description: Define a launchd job. See launchd.plist(5) for details.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.AbandonProcessGroup
options.description: When a job dies, launchd kills any remaining processes with the same process group ID as the job. Settingthis key to true disables that behavior.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Debug
options.description: This optional key specifies that launchd should adjust its log mask temporarily to LOG_DEBUG whiledealing with this job.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Disabled
options.description: This optional key is used as a hint to launchctl(1) that it should not submit this job to launchd whenloading a job or jobs. The value of this key does NOT reflect the current state of the job on the runningsystem. If you wish to know whether a job is loaded in launchd, reading this key from a configurationfile yourself is not a sufficient test. You should query launchd for the presence of the job usingthe launchctl(1) list subcommand or use the ServiceManagement framework’sSMJobCopyDictionary() method.
options.note: Note that as of Mac OS X v10.6, this key’s value in a configuration file conveys a default value, whichis changed with the [-w] option of the launchctl(1) load and unload subcommands. These subcommands nolonger modify the configuration file, so the value displayed in the configuration file is not necessarilythe value that launchctl(1) will apply. See launchctl(1) for more information.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.EnableGlobbing
options.description: This flag causes launchd to use the glob(3) mechanism to update the program arguments before invocation.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.EnableTransactions
options.description: This flag instructs launchd that the job promises to use vproc_transaction_begin(3) andvproc_transaction_end(3) to track outstanding transactions that need to be reconciled before theprocess can safely terminate. If no outstanding transactions are in progress, then launchd is free tosend the SIGKILL signal.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.EnvironmentVariables
options.description: This optional key is used to specify additional environment variables to be set before running thejob.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ExitTimeOut
options.description: The amount of time launchd waits before sending a SIGKILL signal. The default value is 20 seconds. Thevalue zero is interpreted as infinity.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.GroupName
options.description: This optional key specifies the group to run the job as. This key is only applicable when launchd isrunning as root. If UserName is set and GroupName is not, the the group will be set to the defaultgroup of the user.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits
options.description: Resource limits to be imposed on the job. These adjust variables set with setrlimit(2).  The followingkeys apply:

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.CPU
options.description: The maximum amount of cpu time (in seconds) to be used by each process.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.Core
options.description: The largest size (in bytes) core file that may be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.Data
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of the data segment for a process; this defines how far a program mayextend its break with the sbrk(2) system call.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.FileSize
options.description: The largest size (in bytes) file that may be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.MemoryLock
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) which a process may lock into memory using the mlock(2) function.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.NumberOfFiles
options.description: The maximum number of open files for this process.  Setting this value in a system wide daemonwill set the sysctl(3) kern.maxfiles (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxfilesperproc (HardResourceLimits)value in addition to the setrlimit(2) values.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.NumberOfProcesses
options.description: The maximum number of simultaneous processes for this user id.  Setting this value in a systemwide daemon will set the sysctl(3) kern.maxproc (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxprocperuid(HardResourceLimits) value in addition to the setrlimit(2) values.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.ResidentSetSize
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) to which a process’s resident set size may grow.  This imposes alimit on the amount of physical memory to be given to a process; if memory is tight, the systemwill prefer to take memory from processes that are exceeding their declared resident set size.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.Stack
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of the stack segment for a process; this defines how far a program’sstack segment may be extended.  Stack extension is performed automatically by the system.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.InitGroups
options.description: This optional key specifies whether initgroups(3) should be called before running the job.  The defaultis true in 10.5 and false in 10.4. This key will be ignored if the UserName key is not set.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.KeepAlive
options.description: This optional key is used to control whether your job is to be kept continuously running or to letdemand and conditions control the invocation. The default is false and therefore only demand will startthe job. The value may be set to true to unconditionally keep the job alive. Alternatively, a dictionaryof conditions may be specified to selectively control whether launchd keeps a job alive or not. Ifmultiple keys are provided, launchd ORs them, thus providing maximum flexibility to the job to refinethe logic and stall if necessary. If launchd finds no reason to restart the job, it falls back ondemand based invocation.  Jobs that exit quickly and frequently when configured to be kept alive willbe throttled to converve system resources.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Label
options.description: This required key uniquely identifies the job to launchd.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LaunchEvents
options.description: Specifies higher-level event types to be used as launch-on-demand eventsources.  Each sub-dictionary defines events for a particular eventsubsystem, such as “com.apple.iokit.matching”, which can be used tolaunch jobs based on the appearance of nodes in the IORegistry. Eachdictionary within the sub-dictionary specifies an event descriptor thatis specified to each event subsystem. With this key, the job promises touse the xpc_set_event_stream_handler(3) API to consume events. Seexpc_events(3) for more details on event sources.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LaunchOnlyOnce
options.description: This optional key specifies whether the job can only be run once and only once.  In other words, if thejob cannot be safely respawned without a full machine reboot, then set this key to be true.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LimitLoadFromHosts
options.description: This configuration file only applies to hosts NOT listed with this key. Note: One should set kern.hostnamein sysctl.conf(5) for this feature to work reliably.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LimitLoadToHosts
options.description: This configuration file only applies to the hosts listed with this key. Note: One should set kern.hostnamein sysctl.conf(5) for this feature to work reliably.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LimitLoadToSessionType
options.description: This configuration file only applies to sessions of the type specified. This key is used in concertwith the -S flag to launchctl.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LowPriorityIO
options.description: This optional key specifies whether the kernel should consider this daemon to be low priority whendoing file system I/O.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.MachServices
options.description: This optional key is used to specify Mach services to be registered with the Mach bootstrap sub-system.Each key in this dictionary should be the name of service to be advertised. The value of the key mustbe a boolean and set to true.  Alternatively, a dictionary can be used instead of a simple true value.
options.note: Finally, for the job itself, the values will be replaced with Mach ports at the time of check-in withlaunchd.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.MachServices.HideUntilCheckIn
options.description: Reserve the name in the namespace, but cause bootstrap_look_up() to fail until the job haschecked in with launchd.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.MachServices.ResetAtClose
options.description: If this boolean is false, the port is recycled, thus leaving clients to remain oblivious to thedemand nature of job. If the value is set to true, clients receive port death notifications whenthe job lets go of the receive right. The port will be recreated atomically with respect to bootstrap_look_up()calls, so that clients can trust that after receiving a port death notification,the new port will have already been recreated. Setting the value to true should be done withcare. Not all clients may be able to handle this behavior. The default value is false.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Nice
options.description: This optional key specifies what nice(3) value should be applied to the daemon.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.OnDemand
options.description: This key was used in Mac OS X 10.4 to control whether a job was kept alive or not. The default wastrue.  This key has been deprecated and replaced in Mac OS X 10.5 and later with the more powerfulKeepAlive option.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ProcessType
options.description: This optional key describes, at a high level, the intended purpose of the job.  The system will applyresource limits based on what kind of job it is. If left unspecified, the system will apply lightresource limits to the job, throttling its CPU usage and I/O bandwidth. The following are valid values:
options.note: BackgroundBackground jobs are generally processes that do work that was not directly requested by the user.The resource limits applied to Background jobs are intended to prevent them from disrupting theuser experience.StandardStandard jobs are equivalent to no ProcessType being set.AdaptiveAdaptive jobs move between the Background and Interactive classifications based on activity overXPC connections. See xpc_transaction_begin(3) for details.InteractiveInteractive jobs run with the same resource limitations as apps, that is to say, none. Interactivejobs are critical to maintaining a responsive user experience, and this key should only beused if an app’s ability to be responsive depends on it, and cannot be made Adaptive.

options.description: Background jobs are generally processes that do work that was not directly requested by the user.The resource limits applied to Background jobs are intended to prevent them from disrupting theuser experience.
Standard jobs are equivalent to no ProcessType being set.
Adaptive jobs move between the Background and Interactive classifications based on activity overXPC connections. See xpc_transaction_begin(3) for details.

Interactive jobs run with the same resource limitations as apps, that is to say, none. Interactivejobs are critical to maintaining a responsive user experience, and this key should only beused if an app’s ability to be responsive depends on it, and cannot be made Adaptive.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Program
options.description: This key maps to the first argument of execvp(3).  If this key is missing, then the first element ofthe array of strings provided to the ProgramArguments will be used instead.  This key is required inthe absence of the ProgramArguments key.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ProgramArguments
options.description: This key maps to the second argument of execvp(3).  This key is required in the absence of the Programkey. Please note: many people are confused by this key. Please read execvp(3) very carefully!

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.QueueDirectories
options.description: Much like the WatchPaths option, this key will watch the paths for modifications. The difference beingthat the job will only be started if the path is a directory and the directory is not empty.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.RootDirectory
options.description: This optional key is used to specify a directory to chroot(2) to before running the job.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.RunAtLoad
options.description: This optional key is used to control whether your job is launched once at the time the job is loaded.The default is false.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets
options.description: This optional key is used to specify launch on demand sockets that can be used to let launchd know whento run the job. The job must check-in to get a copy of the file descriptors using APIs outlined inlaunch(3).  The keys of the top level Sockets dictionary can be anything. They are meant for the applicationdeveloper to use to differentiate which descriptors correspond to which application level protocols(e.g. http vs. ftp vs. DNS…).  At check-in time, the value of each Sockets dictionary key willbe an array of descriptors. Daemon/Agent writers should consider all descriptors of a given key to beto be effectively equivalent, even though each file descriptor likely represents a different networkingprotocol which conforms to the criteria specified in the job configuration file.
options.note: The parameters below are used as inputs to call getaddrinfo(3).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.Bonjour
options.description: This optional key can be used to request that the service be registered with themDNSResponder(8).  If the value is boolean, the service name is inferred from the SockServiceName.
options.type: null or boolean or list of string

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.MulticastGroup
options.description: This optional key can be used to request that the datagram socket join a multicast group.  If thevalue is a hostname, then getaddrinfo(3) will be used to join the correct multicast address for agiven socket family.  If an explicit IPv4 or IPv6 address is given, it is required that the SockFamilyfamily also be set, otherwise the results are undefined.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SecureSocketWithKey
options.description: This optional key is a variant of SockPathName. Instead of binding to a known path, a securelygenerated socket is created and the path is assigned to the environment variable that is inheritedby all jobs spawned by launchd.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockFamily
options.description: This optional key can be used to specifically request that “IPv4” or “IPv6” socket(s) be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockNodeName
options.description: This optional key specifies the node to connect(2) or bind(2) to.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockPassive
options.description: This optional key specifies whether listen(2) or connect(2) should be called on the created filedescriptor. The default is true (“to listen”).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockPathMode
options.description: This optional key specifies the mode of the socket. Known bug: Property lists don’t supportoctal, so please convert the value to decimal.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockPathName
options.description: This optional key implies SockFamily is set to “Unix”. It specifies the path to connect(2) orbind(2) to.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockProtocol
options.description: This optional key specifies the protocol to be passed to socket(2).  The only value understood bythis key at the moment is “TCP”.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockServiceName
options.description: This optional key specifies the service on the node to connect(2) or bind(2) to.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockType
options.description: This optional key tells launchctl what type of socket to create. The default is “stream” andother valid values for this key are “dgram” and “seqpacket” respectively.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits
options.description: Resource limits to be imposed on the job. These adjust variables set with setrlimit(2).  The followingkeys apply:

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.CPU
options.description: The maximum amount of cpu time (in seconds) to be used by each process.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.Core
options.description: The largest size (in bytes) core file that may be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.Data
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of the data segment for a process; this defines how far a program mayextend its break with the sbrk(2) system call.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.FileSize
options.description: The largest size (in bytes) file that may be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.MemoryLock
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) which a process may lock into memory using the mlock(2) function.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.NumberOfFiles
options.description: The maximum number of open files for this process.  Setting this value in a system wide daemonwill set the sysctl(3) kern.maxfiles (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxfilesperproc (HardResourceLimits)value in addition to the setrlimit(2) values.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.NumberOfProcesses
options.description: The maximum number of simultaneous processes for this user id.  Setting this value in a systemwide daemon will set the sysctl(3) kern.maxproc (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxprocperuid(HardResourceLimits) value in addition to the setrlimit(2) values.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.ResidentSetSize
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) to which a process’s resident set size may grow.  This imposes alimit on the amount of physical memory to be given to a process; if memory is tight, the systemwill prefer to take memory from processes that are exceeding their declared resident set size.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.Stack
options.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of the stack segment for a process; this defines how far a program’sstack segment may be extended.  Stack extension is performed automatically by the system.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StandardErrorPath
options.description: This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being sent to stderr when using stdio(3).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StandardInPath
options.description: This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being supplied to stdin when usingstdio(3).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StandardOutPath
options.description: This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being sent to stdout when using stdio(3).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval
options.description: This optional key causes the job to be started every calendar interval as specified. Missing argumentsare considered to be wildcard. The semantics are much like crontab(5).  Unlike cron which skips jobinvocations when the computer is asleep, launchd will start the job the next time the computer wakesup.  If multiple intervals transpire before the computer is woken, those events will be coalesced intoone event upon wake from sleep.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Day
options.description: The day on which this job will be run.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Hour
options.description: The hour on which this job will be run.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Minute
options.description: The minute on which this job will be run.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Month
options.description: The month on which this job will be run.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Weekday
options.description: The weekday on which this job will be run (0 and 7 are Sunday).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartInterval
options.description: This optional key causes the job to be started every N seconds.  If the system is asleep, the job willbe started the next time the computer wakes up.  If multiple intervals transpire before the computer iswoken, those events will be coalesced into one event upon wake from sleep.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartOnMount
options.description: This optional key causes the job to be started every time a filesystem is mounted.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ThrottleInterval
options.description: This key lets one override the default throttling policy imposed on jobs by launchd.  The value is inseconds, and by default, jobs will not be spawned more than once every 10 seconds.  The principlebehind this is that jobs should linger around just in case they are needed again in the near future.This not only reduces the latency of responses, but it encourages developers to amortize the cost ofprogram invocation.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.TimeOut
options.description: The recommended idle time out (in seconds) to pass to the job. If no value is specified, a default timeout will be supplied by launchd for use by the job at check in time.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Umask
options.description: This optional key specifies what value should be passed to umask(2) before running the job. Known bug:Property lists don’t support octal, so please convert the value to decimal.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.UserName
options.description: This optional key specifies the user to run the job as. This key is only applicable when launchd isrunning as root.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.WaitForDebugger
options.description: This optional key specifies that launchd should instruct the kernel to have the job wait for a debuggerto attach before any code in the job is executed.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.WatchPaths
options.description: This optional key causes the job to be started if any one of the listed paths are modified.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.WorkingDirectory
options.description: This optional key is used to specify a directory to chdir(2) to before running the job.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.inetdCompatibility
options.description: The presence of this key specifies that the daemon expects to be run as if it were launched from inetd.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.inetdCompatibility.Wait
options.description: This flag corresponds to the “wait” or “nowait” option of inetd. If true, then the listeningsocket is passed via the standard in/out/error file descriptors. If false, then accept(2) iscalled on behalf of the job, and the result is passed via the standard in/out/error descriptors.

options.title: lib
options.description: This option allows modules to define helper functions,constants, etc.

options.title: manual.html.enable
options.description: Whether to install the HTML manual. This also installs thehome-manager-help tool, which opens a localcopy of the Home Manager manual in the system web browser.

options.title: manual.json.enable
options.description: Whether to install a JSON formatted list of all Home Manageroptions. This can be located at<profile directory>/share/doc/home-manager/options.json,and may be used for navigating definitions, auto-completing,and other miscellaneous tasks.

options.title: manual.manpages.enable
options.description: Whether to install the configuration manual page. The manual canbe reached by man home-configuration.nix.
options.note: When looking at the manual page pretend that all references toNixOS stuff are actually references to Home Manager stuff.Thanks!

options.title: news.display
options.description: How unread and relevant news should be presented whenrunning home-manager build andhome-manager switch.
options.note: The options are

options.description: Do not print anything during build or switch. Thehome-manager news command stillworks for viewing the entries.
The number of unread and relevant news entries will beprinted to standard output. The home-manager news command can later be used to view the entries.
A pager showing unread news entries is opened.

options.title: nix.package
options.description: The Nix package that the configuration should be generated for.

options.title: nix.checkConfig
options.description: If enabled (the default), checks for data type mismatches and that Nixcan parse the generated nix.conf.

options.title: nix.extraOptions
options.description: Additional text appended to nix.conf.

options.title: nix.registry
options.description: User level flake registry.

options.title: nix.registry.<name>.exact
options.description: Whether the from reference needs to match exactly. If set,a from reference like nixpkgs does notmatch with a reference like nixpkgs/nixos-20.03.

options.title: nix.registry.<name>.flake
options.description: The flake input to which from> is to be rewritten.

options.title: nix.registry.<name>.from
options.description: The flake reference to be rewritten.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or package)

options.title: nix.registry.<name>.to
options.description: The flake reference to which from> is to be rewritten.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or package)

options.title: nix.settings
options.description: Configuration for Nix; see nix.conf(5) for available options.The value declared here will be translated directly to the key-value pairs Nix expects.
options.note: Configuration specified in nix.extraOptions will be appendedverbatim to the resulting config file.
options.type: attribute set of (Nix config atom (null, bool, int, float, str, path or package) or list of (Nix config atom (null, bool, int, float, str, path or package)))

options.title: nixpkgs.config
options.description: The configuration of the Nix Packages collection. (Fordetails, see the Nixpkgs documentation.) It allows you to setpackage configuration options.
options.note: If null, then configuration is taken fromthe fallback location, for example,~/.config/nixpkgs/config.nix.

options.title: nixpkgs.overlays
options.description: List of overlays to use with the Nix Packages collection. (Fordetails, see the Nixpkgs documentation.) It allows you tooverride packages globally. This is a function that takes asan argument the original Nixpkgs. Thefirst argument should be used for finding dependencies, andthe second should be used for overriding recipes.
options.note: If null, then the overlays are taken fromthe fallback location, for example,~/.config/nixpkgs/overlays.
options.example: [  (final: prev: {    openssh = prev.openssh.override {      hpnSupport = true;      withKerberos = true;      kerberos = final.libkrb5;    };  })]

options.title: pam.sessionVariables
options.description: Environment variables that will be set for the PAM session.The variable values must be as described inpam_env.conf(5).
options.note: Note, this option will become deprecated in the future and its use istherefore discouraged.

options.title: pam.yubico.authorizedYubiKeys.ids
options.description: List of authorized YubiKey token IDs. Refer tohttps://developers.yubico.com/yubico-pamfor details on how to obtain the token ID of a YubiKey.

options.title: pam.yubico.authorizedYubiKeys.path
options.description: File path to write the authorized YubiKeys,relative to HOME.

options.title: programs.abook.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Abook.

options.title: programs.abook.extraConfig
options.description: Extra lines added to $HOME/.config/abook/abookrc.Available configuration options are described in the abook repository:https://sourceforge.net/p/abook/git/ci/master/tree/sample.abookrc.
options.example: ''  field pager = Pager  view CONTACT = name, email  set autosave=true''

options.title: programs.aerc.enable
options.description: Whether to enable aerc.

options.title: programs.aerc.package
options.description: The aerc package to use.

options.title: programs.aerc.extraAccounts
options.description: Extra lines added to $HOME/.config/aerc/accounts.conf.
options.note: See aerc-config(5).
options.type: strings concatenated with “\n” or attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string, or float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

options.title: programs.aerc.extraBinds
options.description: Extra lines added to $HOME/.config/aerc/binds.conf.Global keybindings can be set in the global section.
options.note: See aerc-config(5).
options.type: strings concatenated with “\n” or attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string, or float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

options.title: programs.aerc.extraConfig
options.description: Extra lines added to $HOME/.config/aerc/aerc.conf.
options.note: See aerc-config(5).
options.type: strings concatenated with “\n” or attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string, or float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

options.title: programs.aerc.stylesets
options.description: Stylesets added to $HOME/.config/aerc/stylesets/.
options.note: See aerc-stylesets(7).
options.type: attribute set of ((attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string, or float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)) or strings concatenated with “\n”)

options.title: programs.aerc.templates
options.description: Templates added to $HOME/.config/aerc/templates/.
options.note: See aerc-templates(7).
options.type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n”

options.title: programs.afew.enable
options.description: Whether to enable the afew initial tagging script for Notmuch.

options.title: programs.afew.extraConfig
options.description: Extra lines added to afew configuration file. Availableconfiguration options are described in the afew manual:https://afew.readthedocs.io/en/latest/configuration.html.
options.example: ''  [SpamFilter]    [Filter.0]  query = from:pointyheaded@boss.com  tags = -new;+boss  message = Message from above    [InboxFilter]''

options.title: programs.alacritty.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Alacritty.

options.title: programs.alacritty.package
options.description: The Alacritty package to install.

options.title: programs.alacritty.settings
options.description: Configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/alacritty/alacritty.yml. Seehttps://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/blob/master/alacritty.ymlfor the default configuration.
options.example: {  window.dimensions = {    lines = 3;    columns = 200;  };  key_bindings = [    {      key = "K";      mods = "Control";      chars = "\\x0c";    }  ];}

options.title: programs.alot.enable
options.description: Whether to enable the Alot mail user agent. Alot uses theNotmuch email system and will therefore be automaticallyenabled for each email account that is managed by Notmuch.

options.title: programs.alot.bindings
options.description: Keybindings.

options.title: programs.alot.bindings.bufferlist
options.description: Bufferlist mode keybindings.

options.title: programs.alot.bindings.envelope
options.description: Envelope mode keybindings.

options.title: programs.alot.bindings.global
options.description: Global keybindings.

options.title: programs.alot.bindings.search
options.description: Search mode keybindings.

options.title: programs.alot.bindings.taglist
options.description: Taglist mode keybindings.

options.title: programs.alot.bindings.thread
options.description: Thread mode keybindings.

options.title: programs.alot.extraConfig
options.description: Extra lines added to alot configuration file.

options.title: programs.alot.hooks
options.description: Content of the hooks file.

options.title: programs.alot.settings
options.description: Configuration options added to alot configuration file.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number)

options.title: programs.alot.tags
options.description: How to display the tags.

options.title: programs.alot.tags.<name>.focus
options.description: How to display the tag when focused.

options.title: programs.alot.tags.<name>.normal
options.description: How to display the tag when unfocused.See https://alot.readthedocs.io/en/latest/configuration/theming.html#tagstring-formatting.

options.title: programs.alot.tags.<name>.translated
options.description: Fixed string representation for this tag. The tag can behidden from view, if the key translated is set to"", the empty string.

options.title: programs.alot.tags.<name>.translation
options.description: A pair of strings that define a regular substitution tocompute the string representation on the fly usingre.sub.

options.title: programs.aria2.extraConfig

options.title: programs.astroid.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Astroid.

options.title: programs.astroid.externalEditor
options.description: You can use the following variables:
options.note: %1file name%2server name%3socket ID

options.description: file name
server name
socket ID

options.title: programs.astroid.extraConfig
options.description: JSON config that will override the default Astroid configuration.

options.title: programs.astroid.pollScript

options.title: programs.atuin.enable

options.title: programs.autorandr.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Autorandr.

options.title: programs.autorandr.hooks
options.description: Global hook scripts
options.example: {  postswitch = {    "notify-i3" = "${pkgs.i3}/bin/i3-msg restart";    "change-background" = readFile ./change-background.sh;    "change-dpi" = ''      case "$AUTORANDR_CURRENT_PROFILE" in        default)          DPI=120          ;;        home)          DPI=192          ;;        work)          DPI=144          ;;        *)          echo "Unknown profile: $AUTORANDR_CURRENT_PROFILE"          exit 1      esac      echo "Xft.dpi: $DPI" | ${pkgs.xorg.xrdb}/bin/xrdb -merge    ''  };}

options.title: programs.autorandr.hooks.postswitch
options.description: Postswitch hook executed after mode switch.
options.type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n”

options.title: programs.autorandr.hooks.predetect
options.description: Predetect hook executed before autorandr attempts to run xrandr.
options.type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n”

options.title: programs.autorandr.hooks.preswitch
options.description: Preswitch hook executed before mode switch.
options.type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n”

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles
options.description: Autorandr profiles specification.
options.example: {  "work" = {    fingerprint = {      eDP1 = "<EDID>";      DP1 = "<EDID>";    };    config = {      eDP1.enable = false;      DP1 = {        enable = true;        crtc = 0;        primary = true;        position = "0x0";        mode = "3840x2160";        gamma = "1.0:0.909:0.833";        rate = "60.00";        rotate = "left";      };    };    hooks.postswitch = readFile ./work-postswitch.sh;  };}

options.description: Define new verbs. For more information, seeVerb Definition Attributesin the broot documentation.
options.note: The possible attributes are:
options.type: list of attribute set of (boolean or string)
options.example: [  { invocation = "p"; execution = ":parent"; }  { invocation = "edit"; shortcut = "e"; execution = "$EDITOR {file}" ; }  { invocation = "create {subpath}"; execution = "$EDITOR {directory}/{subpath}"; }  { invocation = "view"; execution = "less {file}"; }  {    invocation = "blop {name}\\.{type}";    execution = "mkdir {parent}/{type} && ${pkgs.neovim}/bin/nvim {parent}/{type}/{name}.{type}";    from_shell = true;  }]

options.description: how the verb is called by the user, with placeholders for arguments
how the verb is executed
a keyboard key triggering execution
an alternate way to call the verb (withoutthe arguments part)
whether to quit broot on execution(default: true)
whether the verb must be executed from theparent shell (default: false)

options.description: The Emacs package to use.

options.title: programs.emacs.extraConfig
options.description: Configuration to include in the Emacs default init file. Seehttps://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/manual/html_node/elisp/Init-File.htmlfor more.

options.title: programs.emacs.extraPackages
options.description: Extra packages available to Emacs. To get a list ofavailable packages run:nix-env -f '<nixpkgs>' -qaP -A emacsPackages.
options.type: Function that takes an attribute set and returns a list containing a selection of the values of the input set

options.title: programs.emacs.overrides
options.description: Allows overriding packages within the Emacs package set.
options.type: An overlay function, takes self and super and returns an attribute set overriding the desired attributes.

options.title: programs.eww.enable
options.description: Whether to enable eww.

options.title: programs.eww.package
options.description: The eww package to install.

options.title: programs.eww.configDir
options.description: The directory that gets symlinked to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/eww.

options.description: Whether to enable recommended eza aliases (ls, ll…).

options.title: programs.eza.package
options.description: The eza package to use.

options.title: programs.eza.extraOptions
options.description: Extra command line options passed to eza.

options.description: List each file’s Git status if tracked or ignored (--git argument).

options.title: programs.eza.icons
options.description: Display icons next to file names (--icons argument).

options.title: programs.feh.enable
options.description: Whether to enable feh - a fast and light image viewer.

options.title: programs.feh.package
options.description: The feh package to use.

options.title: programs.feh.buttons
options.description: Override feh’s default mouse button mapping. If you want to disable anaction, set its value to null. If you want to bind multiple buttons toan action, set its value to a list.See https://man.finalrewind.org/1/feh/#x425554544f4e53 fordefault bindings and available commands.
options.type: attribute set of (null or string or signed integer or list of (string or signed integer))

options.title: programs.feh.keybindings
options.description: Override feh’s default keybindings. If you want to disable a keybindingset its value to null. If you want to bind multiple keys to an action,set its value to a list.See https://man.finalrewind.org/1/feh/#x4b455953 fordefault bindings and available commands.
options.type: attribute set of (null or string or list of string)

options.title: programs.firefox.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Firefox.

options.title: programs.firefox.enableGnomeExtensions
options.description: Whether to enable the GNOME Shell native host connector. Note, youalso need to set the NixOS optionservices.gnome.gnome-browser-connector.enable totrue.

options.title: programs.firefox.package
options.description: The Firefox package to use. If state version ≥ 19.09 thenthis should be a wrapped Firefox package. For earlier stateversions it should be an unwrapped Firefox package.Set to null to disable installing Firefox.
options.example: pkgs.firefox.override {  # See nixpkgs' firefox/wrapper.nix to check which options you can use  cfg = {    # Gnome shell native connector    enableGnomeExtensions = true;    # Tridactyl native connector    enableTridactylNative = true;  };}

options.title: programs.firefox.finalPackage
options.description: Resulting Firefox package.

options.title: programs.firefox.policies
options.description: See list of policies.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles
options.description: Attribute set of Firefox profiles.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.bookmarks
options.description: Preloaded bookmarks. Note, this may silently overwrite anypreviously existing bookmarks!
options.type: (list of ((bookmark submodule) or (directory submodule))) or (attribute set of ((bookmark submodule) or (directory submodule))) convertible to it
options.example: [  {    name = "wikipedia";    tags = [ "wiki" ];    keyword = "wiki";    url = "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search?search=%s&go=Go";  }  {    name = "kernel.org";    url = "https://www.kernel.org";  }  {    name = "Nix sites";    toolbar = true;    bookmarks = [      {        name = "homepage";        url = "https://nixos.org/";      }      {        name = "wiki";        tags = [ "wiki" "nix" ];        url = "https://nixos.wiki/";      }    ];  }]

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.containers
options.description: Attribute set of container configurations. SeeMulti-AccountContainersfor more information.
options.example: {  dangerous = {    color = "red";    icon = "fruit";    id = 2;  };  shopping = {    color = "blue";    icon = "cart";    id = 1;  };}

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.containers.<name>.color
options.description: Container color.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.containers.<name>.icon
options.description: Container icon.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.containers.<name>.id
options.description: Container ID. This should be set to a unique number per container in this profile.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.containers.<name>.name
options.description: Container name, e.g., shopping.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.extensions
options.description: List of Firefox add-on packages to install for this profile.Some pre-packaged add-ons are accessible from theNix User Repository.Once you have NUR installed run
options.note: $ nix-env -f '<nixpkgs>' -qaP -A nur.repos.rycee.firefox-addons

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.extraConfig
options.description: Extra preferences to add to user.js.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.id
options.description: Profile ID. This should be set to a unique number per profile.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.isDefault
options.description: Whether this is a default profile.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.name
options.description: Profile name.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.path
options.description: Profile path.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.search.default
options.description: The default search engine used in the address bar and search bar.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.search.engines
options.description: Attribute set of search engine configurations. Enginesthat only have metaData specified willbe treated as builtin to Firefox.
options.note: See SearchEngine.jsmin Firefox’s source for available options. We maintain amapping to let you specify all options in the referencedlink without underscores, but it may fall out of date withfuture options.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (JSON value)
options.example: {  "Nix Packages" = {    urls = [{      template = "https://search.nixos.org/packages";      params = [        { name = "type"; value = "packages"; }        { name = "query"; value = "{searchTerms}"; }      ];    }];    icon = "${pkgs.nixos-icons}/share/icons/hicolor/scalable/apps/nix-snowflake.svg";    definedAliases = [ "@np" ];  };  "NixOS Wiki" = {    urls = [{ template = "https://nixos.wiki/index.php?search={searchTerms}"; }];    iconUpdateURL = "https://nixos.wiki/favicon.png";    updateInterval = 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000; # every day    definedAliases = [ "@nw" ];  };  "Bing".metaData.hidden = true;  "Google".metaData.alias = "@g"; # builtin engines only support specifying one additional alias}

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.search.force
options.description: Whether to force replace the existing searchconfiguration. This is recommended since Firefox willreplace the symlink for the search configuration on everylaunch, but note that you’ll lose any existingconfiguration by enabling this.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.search.order
options.description: The order the search engines are listed in. Any enginesthat aren’t included in this list will be listed afterthese in an unspecified order.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.search.privateDefault
options.description: The default search engine used in the Private Browsing.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.settings
options.description: Attribute set of Firefox preferences.
options.note: Firefox only supports int, bool, and string types forpreferences, but home-manager will automaticallyconvert all other JSON-compatible values into strings.
options.type: attribute set of (Firefox preference (int, bool, string, and also attrs, list, float as a JSON string))

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.userChrome
options.description: Custom Firefox user chrome CSS.
options.example: ''  /* Hide tab bar in FF Quantum */  @-moz-document url("chrome://browser/content/browser.xul") {    #TabsToolbar {      visibility: collapse !important;      margin-bottom: 21px !important;    }      #sidebar-box[sidebarcommand="treestyletab_piro_sakura_ne_jp-sidebar-action"] #sidebar-header {      visibility: collapse !important;    }  }''

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.userContent
options.description: Custom Firefox user content CSS.

options.description: Shell script code called during fish login shellinitialisation.

options.title: programs.fish.plugins
options.description: The plugins to source inconf.d/99plugins.fish.
options.example: [  {    name = "z";    src = pkgs.fetchFromGitHub {      owner = "jethrokuan";      repo = "z";      rev = "ddeb28a7b6a1f0ec6dae40c636e5ca4908ad160a";      sha256 = "0c5i7sdrsp0q3vbziqzdyqn4fmp235ax4mn4zslrswvn8g3fvdyh";    };  }  # oh-my-fish plugins are stored in their own repositories, which  # makes them simple to import into home-manager.  {    name = "fasd";    src = pkgs.fetchFromGitHub {      owner = "oh-my-fish";      repo = "plugin-fasd";      rev = "38a5b6b6011106092009549e52249c6d6f501fba";      sha256 = "06v37hqy5yrv5a6ssd1p3cjd9y3hnp19d3ab7dag56fs1qmgyhbs";    };  }]

options.title: programs.fish.plugins.*.name
options.description: The name of the plugin.

options.example: {  decorations = {    commit-decoration-style = "bold yellow box ul";    file-decoration-style = "none";    file-style = "bold yellow ul";  };  features = "decorations";  whitespace-error-style = "22 reverse";}

options.title: programs.go.goBin
options.description: GOBIN relative to HOME

options.title: programs.go.goPath
options.description: Primary GOPATH relative toHOME. It will be exported first and thereforeused by default by the Go tooling.

options.title: programs.go.goPrivate
options.description: The GOPRIVATE environment variable controlswhich modules the go command considers to be private (notavailable publicly) and should therefore not use the proxyor checksum database.

options.title: programs.gpg.enable
options.description: Whether to enable GnuPG.

options.title: programs.gpg.package
options.description: The Gnupg package to use (also used by the gpg-agent service).

options.title: programs.gpg.homedir
options.description: Directory to store keychains and configuration.

options.title: programs.gpg.mutableKeys
options.description: If set to true, you may manage your keyring as a userusing the gpg command. Upon activation, the keyringwill have managed keys added without overwriting unmanaged keys.
options.note: If set to false, the path$GNUPGHOME/pubring.kbx will become an immutablelink to the Nix store, denying modifications.

options.title: programs.gpg.mutableTrust
options.description: If set to true, you may manage trust as a user usingthe gpg command. Upon activation, trusted keys havetheir trust set without overwriting unmanaged keys.
options.note: If set to false, the path$GNUPGHOME/trustdb.gpg will beoverwritten on each activation, removing trust forany unmanaged keys. Be careful to make a backup of your oldtrustdb.gpg before switching to immutable trust!

options.title: programs.gpg.publicKeys
options.description: A list of public keys to be imported into GnuPG. Note, these key fileswill be copied into the world-readable Nix store.

options.title: programs.gpg.publicKeys.*.source
options.description: Path of an OpenPGP public key file.

options.title: programs.gpg.publicKeys.*.text
options.description: Text of an OpenPGP public key.

options.title: programs.gpg.publicKeys.*.trust
options.description: The amount of trust you have in the key ownership and the care theowner puts into signing other keys. The available levels are
options.note: unknown or 1I don’t know or won’t say.never or 2I do not trust.marginal or 3I trust marginally.full or 4I trust fully.ultimate or 5I trust ultimately.

options.description: I don’t know or won’t say.
I do not trust.
I trust marginally.
I trust fully.
I trust ultimately.

options.title: programs.gpg.scdaemonSettings
options.description: SCdaemon configuration options. Available options are describedinscdaemon(1).
options.type: attribute set of (string or boolean or list of string)

options.title: programs.gpg.settings
options.description: GnuPG configuration options. Available options are describedingpg(1).
options.note: Note that lists are converted to duplicate keys.
options.type: attribute set of (string or boolean or list of string)

options.title: programs.granted.enable
options.description: Whether to enable granted.

options.title: programs.granted.enableZshIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.havoc.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Havoc terminal.

options.title: programs.havoc.package
options.description: The havoc package to use.

options.title: programs.havoc.settings
options.description: Configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/havoc.cfg. See https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ii8/havoc/master/havoc.cfgfor a list of available options.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: {  child.program = "bash";  window.opacity = 240;  window.margin = no;  terminal = {    rows = 80;    columns = 24;    scrollback = 2000;  };  bind = {    "C-S-c" = "copy";    "C-S-v" = "paste";    "C-S-r" = "reset";    "C-S-Delete" = "hard reset";    "C-S-j" = "scroll down";    "C-S-k" = "scroll up";    "C-S-Page_Down" = "scroll down page";    "C-S-Page_Up" = "scroll up page";    "C-S-End" = "scroll to bottom";    "C-S-Home" = "scroll to top";  };}

options.title: programs.helix.enable
options.description: Whether to enable helix text editor.

options.title: programs.helix.package
options.description: The package to use for helix.

options.title: programs.helix.defaultEditor
options.description: Whether to configure hx as the defaulteditor using the EDITOR environment variable.

options.title: programs.helix.extraPackages
options.description: Extra packages available to hx.

options.title: programs.helix.languages
options.description: Language specific configuration at$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/helix/languages.toml.
options.note: See https://docs.helix-editor.com/languages.htmlfor more information.
options.type: (TOML value) or (list of (TOML value)) convertible to it
options.example: {  # the language-server option currently requires helix from the master branch at https://github.com/helix-editor/helix/  language-server.typescript-language-server = with pkgs.nodePackages; {    command = "${typescript-language-server}/bin/typescript-language-server";    args = [ "--stdio" "--tsserver-path=${typescript}/lib/node_modules/typescript/lib" ];  };  language = [{    name = "rust";    auto-format = false;  }];}

options.title: programs.helix.settings
options.description: Configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/helix/config.toml.
options.note: See https://docs.helix-editor.com/configuration.htmlfor the full list of options.
options.example: {  theme = "base16";  editor = {    line-number = "relative";    lsp.display-messages = true;  };  keys.normal = {    space.space = "file_picker";    space.w = ":w";    space.q = ":q";    esc = [ "collapse_selection" "keep_primary_selection" ];  };}

options.title: programs.helix.themes
options.description: Each theme is written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/helix/themes/theme-name.toml.Where the name of each attribute is the theme-name (in the example “base16”).
options.note: See https://docs.helix-editor.com/themes.htmlfor the full list of options.
options.example: {  base16 = let    transparent = "none";    gray = "#665c54";    dark-gray = "#3c3836";    white = "#fbf1c7";    black = "#282828";    red = "#fb4934";    green = "#b8bb26";    yellow = "#fabd2f";    orange = "#fe8019";    blue = "#83a598";    magenta = "#d3869b";    cyan = "#8ec07c";  in {    "ui.menu" = transparent;    "ui.menu.selected" = { modifiers = [ "reversed" ]; };    "ui.linenr" = { fg = gray; bg = dark-gray; };    "ui.popup" = { modifiers = [ "reversed" ]; };    "ui.linenr.selected" = { fg = white; bg = black; modifiers = [ "bold" ]; };    "ui.selection" = { fg = black; bg = blue; };    "ui.selection.primary" = { modifiers = [ "reversed" ]; };    "comment" = { fg = gray; };    "ui.statusline" = { fg = white; bg = dark-gray; };    "ui.statusline.inactive" = { fg = dark-gray; bg = white; };    "ui.help" = { fg = dark-gray; bg = white; };    "ui.cursor" = { modifiers = [ "reversed" ]; };    "variable" = red;    "variable.builtin" = orange;    "constant.numeric" = orange;    "constant" = orange;    "attributes" = yellow;    "type" = yellow;    "ui.cursor.match" = { fg = yellow; modifiers = [ "underlined" ]; };    "string" = green;    "variable.other.member" = red;    "constant.character.escape" = cyan;    "function" = blue;    "constructor" = blue;    "special" = blue;    "keyword" = magenta;    "label" = magenta;    "namespace" = blue;    "diff.plus" = green;    "diff.delta" = yellow;    "diff.minus" = red;    "diagnostic" = { modifiers = [ "underlined" ]; };    "ui.gutter" = { bg = black; };    "info" = blue;    "hint" = dark-gray;    "debug" = dark-gray;    "warning" = yellow;    "error" = red;  };}

options.title: programs.hexchat.enable
options.description: Whether to enable HexChat, a graphical IRC client.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels
options.description: Configures $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/hexchat/servlist.conf.
options.example: {  oftc = {    autojoin = [      "#home-manager"      "#linux"    ];    charset = "UTF-8 (Unicode)";    commands = [      "ECHO Buzz Lightyear sent you a message: 'To Infinity... and Beyond!'"    ];    loginMethod = sasl;    nickname = "my_nickname";    nickname2 = "my_secondchoice";    options = {      acceptInvalidSSLCertificates = false;      autoconnect = true;      bypassProxy = true;      connectToSelectedServerOnly = true;      useGlobalUserInformation = false;      forceSSL = false;    };    password = "my_password";    realName = "my_realname";    servers = [      "irc.oftc.net"    ];    userName = "my_username";  };}

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.autojoin
options.description: Channels list to autojoin on connecting to server.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.charset
options.description: Character set.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.commands
options.description: Commands to be executed on connecting to server.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.loginMethod
options.description: The login method. The allowed options are:
options.note: nullDefault"nickServMsg"NickServ (/MSG NickServ + password)"nickServ"NickServ (/NICKSERV + password)"challengeAuth"Challenge Auth (username + password)"sasl"SASL (username + password)"serverPassword"Server password (/PASS password)"saslExternal"SASL EXTERNAL (cert)"customCommands"Use “commands” field for auth. For examplecommands = [ "/msg NickServ IDENTIFY my_password" ]

options.description: Default
NickServ (/MSG NickServ + password)
NickServ (/NICKSERV + password)
Challenge Auth (username + password)
SASL (username + password)
Server password (/PASS password)
SASL EXTERNAL (cert)
Use “commands” field for auth. For example
options.note: commands = [ "/msg NickServ IDENTIFY my_password" ]

options.description: Password to use. Note this password will be readable by all user’sin the Nix store.

options.description: User name. Part of your user@host hostmask thatappears to other on IRC.

options.description: Enables overwriting HexChat configuration files(hexchat.conf, servlist.conf).Any existing HexChat configuration will be lost. Make sure to back upany previous configuration before enabling this.
options.note: Enabling this setting is recommended, because everytime HexChatapplication is closed it overwrites Nix/Home Manager providedconfiguration files, causing:

options.description: Position of this module in i3status order.

options.title: programs.i3status.modules.<name>.settings

options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)

options.title: programs.i3status-rust.enable
options.description: Whether to enable a replacement for i3-status written in Rust.

options.title: programs.i3status-rust.package
options.description: Package providing i3status-rust

options.title: programs.i3status-rust.bars
options.description: Attribute set of i3status-rust bars, each with their own configuration.Each bar name generates a config file suffixed withthe bar’s name from the attribute set, like so:config-${name}.toml.
options.note: This way, multiple config files can be generated, such as for having atop and a bottom bar.
options.example: bottom = {  blocks = [    {       block = "disk_space";       path = "/";       info_type = "available";       interval = 60;       warning = 20.0;       alert = 10.0;     }     {       block = "memory";       format_mem = " $icon $mem_used_percents ";       format_swap = " $icon $swap_used_percents ";     }     {       block = "cpu";       interval = 1;     }     {       block = "load";       interval = 1;       format = " $icon $1m ";     }     { block = "sound"; }     {       block = "time";       interval = 60;       format = " $timestamp.datetime(f:'%a %d/%m %R') ";     }  ];  settings = {    theme =  {      theme = "solarized-dark";      overrides = {        idle_bg = "#123456";        idle_fg = "#abcdef";      };    };  };  icons = "awesome5";  theme = "gruvbox-dark";};

options.title: programs.i3status-rust.bars.<name>.blocks
options.description: Configuration blocks to add to i3status-rustconfig. Seehttps://github.com/greshake/i3status-rust/blob/master/blocks.mdfor block options.
options.example: [  {    block = "disk_space";    path = "/";    info_type = "available";    interval = 60;    warning = 20.0;    alert = 10.0;  }  {    block = "sound";    format = " $icon $output_name {$volume.eng(w:2) |}";    click = [      {        button = "left";        cmd = "pavucontrol --tab=3";      }    ];    mappings = {      "alsa_output.pci-0000_00_1f.3.analog-stereo" = "";      "bluez_sink.70_26_05_DA_27_A4.a2dp_sink" = "";    };  }];

options.description: The icons set to use. Seehttps://github.com/greshake/i3status-rust/blob/master/doc/themes.mdfor a list of available icon sets.

options.description: Any extra options to add to i3status-rustconfig.

options.title: programs.i3status-rust.bars.<name>.theme
options.description: The theme to use. Seehttps://github.com/greshake/i3status-rust/blob/master/doc/themes.mdfor a list of available themes.
