options.title: programs.kakoune.config
options.description: kakoune configuration options.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.alignWithTabs
options.description: Use tabs for the align command.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.autoComplete
options.description: Modes in which to display possible completions.The kakoune default is [ "insert" "prompt" ].

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.autoInfo
options.description: Contexts in which to display automatic information box.The kakoune default is [ "command" "onkey" ].

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.autoReload
options.description: Reload buffers when an external modification is detected.The kakoune default is "ask".

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.colorScheme
options.description: Set the color scheme. To see available schemes, entercolorscheme at the kakoune prompt.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.hooks
options.description: Global hooks. For documentation, seehttps://github.com/mawww/kakoune/blob/master/doc/pages/hooks.asciidoc.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.hooks.*.commands
options.description: Commands to run when the hook is activated.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.hooks.*.group
options.description: Add the hook to the named group.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.hooks.*.name
options.description: The name of the hook. For a description, seehttps://github.com/mawww/kakoune/blob/master/doc/pages/hooks.asciidoc#default-hooks.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.hooks.*.once
options.description: Remove the hook after running it once.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.hooks.*.option
options.description: Additional option to pass to the hook.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.incrementalSearch
options.description: Execute a search as it is being typed.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.indentWidth
options.description: The width of an indentation in spaces.The kakoune default is 4.If 0, a tab will be used instead.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.keyMappings
options.description: User-defined key mappings. For documentation, seehttps://github.com/mawww/kakoune/blob/master/doc/pages/mapping.asciidoc.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.keyMappings.*.docstring
options.description: Optional documentation text to display in info boxes.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.keyMappings.*.effect
options.description: The sequence of keys to be mapped.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.keyMappings.*.key
options.description: The key to be mapped. Seehttps://github.com/mawww/kakoune/blob/master/doc/pages/mapping.asciidoc#mappable-keysfor possible values.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.keyMappings.*.mode
options.description: The mode in which the mapping takes effect.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.numberLines
options.description: Settings for the number lines highlighter.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.numberLines.enable
options.description: Whether to enable the number lines highlighter.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.numberLines.highlightCursor
options.description: Highlight the cursor line with a separate face.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.numberLines.relative
options.description: Show line numbers relative to the main cursor line.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.numberLines.separator
options.description: String that separates the line number column from thebuffer contents. The kakoune default is"|".

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.scrollOff
options.description: How many lines and columns to keep visible around the cursor.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.scrollOff.columns
options.description: The number of columns to keep visible around the cursor.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.scrollOff.lines
options.description: The number of lines to keep visible around the cursor.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showMatching
options.description: Highlight the matching char of the character under theselections’ cursor using the MatchingCharface.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showWhitespace
options.description: Settings for the show whitespaces highlighter.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showWhitespace.enable
options.description: Whether to enable the show whitespace highlighter.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showWhitespace.lineFeed
options.description: The character to display for line feeds.The kakoune default is "¬".

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showWhitespace.nonBreakingSpace
options.description: The character to display for non-breaking spaces.The kakoune default is "⍽".

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showWhitespace.space
options.description: The character to display for spaces.The kakoune default is "·".

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showWhitespace.tab
options.description: The character to display for tabs.The kakoune default is "→".

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showWhitespace.tabStop
options.description: The character to append to tabs to reach the width of a tabstop.The kakoune default is " ".

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.tabStop
options.description: The width of a tab in spaces. The kakoune default is6.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui
options.description: Settings for the ncurses interface.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.enableMouse
options.description: Whether to enable mouse support.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.assistant
options.description: The assistant displayed in info boxes.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.changeColors
options.description: Change color palette.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.setTitle
options.description: Change the title of the terminal emulator.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.shiftFunctionKeys
options.description: Amount by which shifted function keys are offset. Thatis, if the terminal sends F13 for Shift-F1, thisshould be 12.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.statusLine
options.description: Where to display the status line.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.useBuiltinKeyParser
options.description: Bypass ncurses key parser and use an internal one.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.wheelDownButton
options.description: Button to send for wheel down events.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.wheelUpButton
options.description: Button to send for wheel up events.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.wrapLines
options.description: Settings for the wrap lines highlighter.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.wrapLines.enable
options.description: Whether to enable the wrap lines highlighter.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.wrapLines.indent
options.description: Preserve line indentation when wrapping.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.wrapLines.marker
options.description: Prefix wrapped lines with marker text.If not null,the marker text will be displayed in the indentation if possible.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.wrapLines.maxWidth
options.description: Wrap text at maxWidth, even if the window is wider.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.wrapLines.word
options.description: Wrap at word boundaries instead of codepoint boundaries.

options.title: programs.kakoune.defaultEditor
options.description: Whether to configure kak as the defaulteditor using the EDITOR environment variable.

options.title: programs.kakoune.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines to add to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/kak/kakrc.

options.title: programs.kakoune.plugins
options.description: List of kakoune plugins to install. To get a list ofsupported plugins run:nix-env -f '<nixpkgs>' -qaP -A kakounePlugins.

options.title: programs.keychain.enable
options.description: Whether to enable keychain.

options.title: programs.keychain.enableBashIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.keychain.enableFishIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.keychain.enableNushellIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Nushell integration.

options.title: programs.keychain.enableXsessionIntegration
options.description: Whether to run keychain from your ~/.xsession.

options.title: programs.keychain.enableZshIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.keychain.package
options.description: Keychain package to install.

options.title: programs.keychain.agents
options.description: Agents to add.

options.title: programs.keychain.extraFlags
options.description: Extra flags to pass to keychain.

options.title: programs.keychain.inheritType
options.description: Inherit type to attempt from agent variables from the environment.

options.title: programs.keychain.keys
options.description: Keys to add to keychain.

options.title: programs.khal.enable
options.description: Whether to enable khal, a CLI calendar application.

options.title: programs.khal.locale
options.description: khal locale settings.

options.title: programs.khal.locale.dateformat
options.description: khal will display and understand all dates in this format.
options.note: Format strings are for Python strftime, similarly tostrftime(3).

options.title: programs.khal.locale.datetimeformat
options.description: khal will display and understand all datetimes in this format.
options.note: Format strings are for Python strftime, similarly tostrftime(3).

options.title: programs.khal.locale.default_timezone
options.description: Default for new events or if khal does not understand the timezonein an ical file.If null, the timezone of your computer will be used.

options.title: programs.khal.locale.firstweekday
options.description: The first day of the week, where Monday is 0 and Sunday is 6.

options.title: programs.khal.locale.local_timezone
options.description: khal will show all times in this timezone.If null, the timezone of your computer will be used.

options.title: programs.khal.locale.longdateformat
options.description: khal will display and understand all dates in this format.It should contain a year (e.g. %Y).
options.note: Format strings are for Python strftime, similarly tostrftime(3).

options.title: programs.khal.locale.longdatetimeformat
options.description: khal will display and understand all datetimes in this format.It should contain a year (e.g. %Y).
options.note: Format strings are for Python strftime, similarly tostrftime(3).

options.title: programs.khal.locale.timeformat
options.description: khal will display and understand all times in this format.
options.note: Format strings are for Python strftime, similarly tostrftime(3).

options.title: programs.khal.locale.unicode_symbols
options.description: By default khal uses some Unicode symbols (as in “non-ASCII”) asindicators for things like repeating events.If your font, encoding etc. does not support those symbols, set thisto false (this will enable ASCII-based replacements).

options.title: programs.khal.locale.weeknumbers
options.description: Enable week numbers in calendar and interactive (ikhal) mode.As those are ISO week numbers, they only work properly iffirstweekday is set to 0.

options.title: programs.khal.settings
options.description: Configuration options to add to the various sections in the configuration file.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

options.title: programs.khard.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Khard: an address book for the Unix console.

options.title: programs.khard.settings
options.description: Khard settings. Seehttps://khard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#configurationfor more information.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (boolean or string or list of string)
options.example: {  general = {    default_action = "list";    editor = ["vim" "-i" "NONE"];  };  "contact table" = {    display = "formatted_name";    preferred_phone_number_type = ["pref" "cell" "home"];    preferred_email_address_type = ["pref" "work" "home"];  };  vcard = {    private_objects = ["Jabber" "Skype" "Twitter"];  };}

options.title: programs.khard.settings.general.default_action
options.description: The default action to execute.

options.title: programs.kitty.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Kitty terminal emulator.

options.title: programs.kitty.package
options.description: Kitty package to install.

options.title: programs.kitty.darwinLaunchOptions
options.description: Command-line options to use when launched by Mac OS GUI

options.title: programs.kitty.environment
options.description: Environment variables to set or override.

options.title: programs.kitty.extraConfig
options.description: Additional configuration to add.

options.title: programs.kitty.font
options.description: The font to use.

options.title: programs.kitty.font.package
options.description: Package providing the font. This package will be installedto your profile. If null then the fontis assumed to already be available in your profile.

options.title: programs.kitty.font.name
options.description: The family name of the font within the package.

options.title: programs.kitty.font.size
options.description: The size of the font.
options.type: null or signed integer or floating point number

options.title: programs.kitty.keybindings
options.description: Mapping of keybindings to actions.

options.title: programs.kitty.settings
options.description: Configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/kitty/kitty.conf. Seehttps://sw.kovidgoyal.net/kitty/conf.htmlfor the documentation.
options.type: attribute set of (string or boolean or signed integer)

options.title: programs.kitty.shellIntegration.enableBashIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Kitty Bash integration.

options.title: programs.kitty.shellIntegration.enableFishIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Kitty fish integration.

options.title: programs.kitty.shellIntegration.enableZshIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Kitty Z Shell integration.

options.title: programs.kitty.shellIntegration.mode
options.description: Set the mode of the shell integration. This accepts the same optionsas the shell_integration option of Kitty. Note thatno-rc is always implied. Seehttps://sw.kovidgoyal.net/kitty/shell-integrationfor more details.

options.title: programs.kitty.theme
options.description: Apply a Kitty color theme. This option takes the friendly name ofany theme given by the command kitty +kitten themes.See https://github.com/kovidgoyal/kitty-themesfor more details.

options.title: programs.kodi.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Kodi.

options.title: programs.kodi.package
options.description: The kodi package to use.Can be used to specify extensions.

options.title: programs.kodi.addonSettings
options.description: Attribute set with the plugin namespace as toplevel key and the pluginssettings as lower level key/value pairs.
options.note: Kodi will still show the settings of plugins configured via thismechanism in the GUI and they appear to be mutable. This however isnot the case and the settings will stay as specified via Home Manager.
options.type: null or (attribute set of attribute set of string)

options.title: programs.kodi.datadir
options.description: Directory to store configuration and metadata.

options.title: programs.kodi.settings
options.description: Configuration to write to the advancedsettings.xmlfile in kodis userdata directory. Settings specified here will beimmutable from inside kodi and be hidden from the GUI settings dialog.
options.note: See https://kodi.wiki/view/Advancedsettings.xml asreference for how settings need to be specified.
options.type: null or attribute sets of strings

options.title: programs.kodi.sources
options.description: Contents to populate the file sources.xml in kodisuserdata directory.
options.note: See https://kodi.wiki/view/Sources.xml asreference for how sources need to be specified.
options.type: null or attribute sets or lists of strings
options.example: {  video = {    default = "movies";    source = [      { name = "videos"; path = "/path/to/videos"; allowsharing = "true"; }      { name = "movies"; path = "/path/to/movies"; allowsharing = "true"; }    ];  };}

options.title: programs.lazygit.enable
options.description: Whether to enable lazygit, a simple terminal UI for git commands.

options.title: programs.lazygit.package
options.description: The lazygit package to use.

options.title: programs.lazygit.settings
options.description: Configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/lazygit/config.ymlon Linux or on Darwin if xdg.enable is set, otherwise~/Library/Application Support/lazygit/config.yml.Seehttps://github.com/jesseduffield/lazygit/blob/master/docs/Config.mdfor supported values.
options.example: {  gui.theme = {    lightTheme = true;    activeBorderColor = [ "blue" "bold" ];    inactiveBorderColor = [ "black" ];    selectedLineBgColor = [ "default" ];  };}

options.title: programs.ledger.enable
options.description: Whether to enable ledger, a double-entry accounting system.

options.title: programs.ledger.package
options.description: The ledger package to use.

options.title: programs.ledger.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration to add to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/ledger/ledgerrc.

options.title: programs.ledger.settings
options.description: Configuration written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/ledger/ledgerrc.See https://www.ledger-cli.org/3.0/doc/ledger3.html#Detailed-Option-Descriptionfor explanation about possible values.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string or list of string)

options.title: programs.less.enable
options.description: Whether to enable less, opposite of more.

options.title: programs.less.keys
options.description: Extra configuration for less written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/lesskey.

options.title: programs.lesspipe.enable
options.description: Whether to enable lesspipe preprocessor for less.

options.title: programs.lf.enable
options.description: Whether to enable lf.

options.title: programs.lf.package
options.description: lf package to use.

options.title: programs.lf.cmdKeybindings
options.description: Keys to bind to command line commands which can only be one of thebuiltin commands. Keys set to null or an empty string are deleted.

options.title: programs.lf.commands
options.description: Commands to declare. Commands set to null or an empty string aredeleted.

options.title: programs.lf.extraConfig
options.description: Custom lfrc lines.

options.title: programs.lf.keybindings
options.description: Keys to bind. Keys set to null or an empty string are deleted.
options.example: {  D = "trash";  U = "!du -sh";  gg = null;  gh = "cd ~";  i = "$less $f";}

options.title: programs.lf.previewer.keybinding
options.description: Key to bind to the script at previewer.source andpipe through less. Setting to null will not bind any key.

options.title: programs.lf.previewer.source
options.description: Script or executable to use to preview files. Sets lf’spreviewer option.
options.example: pkgs.writeShellScript "pv.sh" ''  #!/bin/sh  case "$1" in      *.tar*) tar tf "$1";;      *.zip) unzip -l "$1";;      *.rar) unrar l "$1";;      *.7z) 7z l "$1";;      *.pdf) pdftotext "$1" -;;      *) highlight -O ansi "$1" || cat "$1";;  esac''

options.title: programs.lf.settings
options.description: An attribute set of lf settings. See the lf documentation fordetailed descriptions of these options. Preferprograms.lf.previewer.* for setting lf’s previeweroption. All string options are quoted with double quotes.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or list of (string or signed integer) or boolean)

options.title: programs.librewolf.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Librewolf browser, a privacy enhanced Firefox fork.

options.title: programs.librewolf.package
options.description: The LibreWolf package to use.

options.title: programs.librewolf.settings
options.description: Attribute set of LibreWolf settings and overrides. Refer tohttps://librewolf.net/docs/settings/for details on supported values.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)

options.title: programs.lieer.enable
options.description: Whether to enable lieer Gmail synchronization for notmuch.

options.title: programs.lieer.package
options.description: lieer package to use.

options.title: programs.looking-glass-client.enable
options.description: Whether to enable looking-glass-client.

options.title: programs.looking-glass-client.package
options.description: The looking-glass-client package to use.

options.title: programs.looking-glass-client.settings
options.description: looking-glass-client settings.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: {  app = {    allowDMA = true;    shmFile = "/dev/kvmfr0";  };  win = {    fullScreen = true;    showFPS = false;    jitRender = true;  };  spice = {    enable = true;    audio = true;  };  input = {    rawMouse = true;    escapeKey = 62;  };}

options.title: programs.lsd.enable
options.description: Whether to enable lsd.

options.title: programs.lsd.enableAliases
options.description: Whether to enable recommended lsd aliases.

options.title: programs.lsd.colors
options.description: Configuration written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/lsd/colors.yaml. Seehttps://github.com/lsd-rs/lsd/tree/v1.0.0#color-theme-file-content forsupported colors.
options.note: If this option is non-empty then the color.theme option isautomatically set to "custom".

options.title: programs.lsd.settings
options.description: Configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/lsd/config.yaml. Seehttps://github.com/Peltoche/lsd#config-file-contentfor supported values.

options.title: programs.man.enable
options.description: Whether to enable manual pages and the mancommand. This also includes “man” outputs of allhome.packages.

options.title: programs.man.package
options.description: The man package to use.

options.title: programs.man.generateCaches
options.description: Whether to generate the manual page index caches usingmandb(8). This allows searching for a page orkeyword using utilities like apropos(1).
options.note: This feature is disabled by default because it slows downbuilding. If you don’t mind waiting a few more seconds whenHome Manager builds a new generation, you may safely enablethis option.

options.title: programs.mangohud.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Mangohud.

options.title: programs.mangohud.enableSessionWide
options.description: Sets environment variables so thatMangoHud is started on any application that supports it.

options.title: programs.mangohud.package
options.description: The Mangohud package to install.

options.title: programs.mangohud.settings
options.description: Configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/MangoHud/MangoHud.conf. Seehttps://github.com/flightlessmango/MangoHud/blob/master/data/MangoHud.conffor the default configuration.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string or path or list of (signed integer or string))

options.title: programs.mangohud.settingsPerApplication
options.description: Sets MangoHud settings per application.Configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/MangoHud/{application_name}.conf. Seehttps://github.com/flightlessmango/MangoHud/blob/master/data/MangoHud.conffor the default configuration.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string or path or list of (signed integer or string))

options.title: programs.matplotlib.enable
options.description: Whether to enable matplotlib, a plotting library for python.

options.title: programs.matplotlib.config
options.description: Add terms to the matplotlibrc file tocontrol the default matplotlib behavior.
options.example: {  backend = "Qt5Agg";  axes = {    grid = true;    facecolor = "black";    edgecolor = "FF9900";  };  grid.color = "FF9900";}

options.title: programs.matplotlib.extraConfig
options.description: Additional commands for matplotlib that will be added to thematplotlibrc file.

options.title: programs.mbsync.enable
options.description: Whether to enable mbsync IMAP4 and Maildir mailbox synchronizer.

options.title: programs.mbsync.package
options.description: The package to use for the mbsync binary.

options.title: programs.mbsync.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines to add to the mbsync configuration.

options.title: programs.mbsync.groups
options.description: Definition of groups.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of list of string

options.title: programs.mcfly.enable
options.description: Whether to enable mcfly.

options.title: programs.mcfly.enableBashIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.mcfly.enableFishIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.mcfly.enableLightTheme
options.description: Whether to enable light mode theme.

options.title: programs.mcfly.enableZshIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.mcfly.fuzzySearchFactor
options.description: Whether to enable fuzzy searching.0 is off; higher numbers weight toward shorter matches.Values in the 2-5 range get good results so far.

options.title: programs.mcfly.keyScheme
options.description: Key scheme to use.

options.title: programs.mercurial.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Mercurial.

options.title: programs.mercurial.package
options.description: Mercurial package to install.

options.title: programs.mercurial.aliases
options.description: Mercurial aliases to define.

options.title: programs.mercurial.extraConfig
options.description: Additional configuration to add.
options.type: (attribute set of anything) or strings concatenated with “\n”

options.title: programs.mercurial.ignores
options.description: List of globs for files to be globally ignored.

options.title: programs.mercurial.ignoresRegexp
options.description: List of regular expressions for files to be globally ignored.

options.title: programs.mercurial.userEmail
options.description: Default user email to use.

options.title: programs.mercurial.userName
options.description: Default user name to use.

options.title: programs.micro.enable
options.description: Whether to enable micro, a terminal-based text editor.

options.title: programs.micro.settings
options.description: Configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/micro/settings.json. Seehttps://github.com/zyedidia/micro/blob/master/runtime/help/options.mdfor supported values.

options.title: programs.mpv.enable
options.description: Whether to enable mpv.

options.title: programs.mpv.package
options.description: Package providing mpv.

options.title: programs.mpv.bindings
options.description: Input configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mpv/input.conf. Seempv(1)for the full list of options.

options.title: programs.mpv.config
options.description: Configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mpv/mpv.conf. Seempv(1)for the full list of options.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number or list of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number))

options.title: programs.mpv.defaultProfiles
options.description: Profiles to be applied by default. Options set by them are overriddenby options set in programs.mpv.config.

options.title: programs.mpv.profiles
options.description: Sub-configuration options for specific profiles written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mpv/mpv.conf. Seeprograms.mpv.config for more information.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number or list of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number))
options.example: {  fast = {    vo = "vdpau";  };  "protocol.dvd" = {    profile-desc = "profile for dvd:// streams";    alang = "en";  };}

options.title: programs.mpv.scriptOpts
options.description: Script options added to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mpv/script-opts/. Seempv(1)for the full list of options of builtin scripts.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number or list of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number))

options.title: programs.mpv.scripts
options.description: List of scripts to use with mpv.

options.title: programs.mr.enable
options.description: Whether to enable mr, a tool to manage all your version control repositories.

options.title: programs.mr.package
options.description: The mr package to use.

options.title: programs.mr.settings

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.keyBindings
options.description: Key bindings mapping keys to commands in different modes. This settingis a dictionary containing mode names and dictionaries mapping keys tocommands: {mode: {key: command}} If you want to mapa key to another key, check the keyMappings settinginstead. For modifiers, you can use either - or+ as delimiters, and these names:
options.note: ControlControl, CtrlMetaMeta, Windows, Mod4AltAlt, Mod1ShiftShift
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of strings concatenated with " ;; "
options.example: {  normal = {    "<Ctrl-v>" = "spawn mpv {url}";    ",p" = "spawn --userscript qute-pass";    ",l" = ''config-cycle spellcheck.languages ["en-GB"] ["en-US"]'';    "<F1>" = mkMerge [      "config-cycle tabs.show never always"      "config-cycle statusbar.show in-mode always"      "config-cycle scrolling.bar never always"    ];  };  prompt = {    "<Ctrl-y>" = "prompt-yes";  };}

options.description: Control, Ctrl
Meta, Windows, Mod4
Alt, Mod1
Shift
Default mode, where most commands are invoked.

Entered when an input field is focused on a website, or bypressing i in normal mode. Passes through almost all keypressesto the website, but has some bindings like<Ctrl-e> to open an external editor.Note that single keys can’t be bound in this mode.
Entered when f is pressed to select links with the keyboard. Notethat single keys can’t be bound in this mode.

Similar to insert mode, but passes through all keypresses except<Escape> to leave the mode. It might beuseful to bind <Escape> to some otherkey in this mode if you want to be able to send an Escape key tothe website as well. Note that single keys can’t be bound in thismode.
Entered when pressing the : key in order to enter a command. Notethat single keys can’t be bound in this mode.
Entered when there’s a prompt to display, like for downloadlocations or when invoked from JavaScript.
Entered when there’s a yes/no prompt displayed.
Entered when pressing the v mode, used to select text using thekeyboard.
Entered when qutebrowser is waiting for a register name/key forcommands like :set-mark.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.keyMappings
options.description: This setting can be used to map keys to other keys. When the key usedas dictionary-key is pressed, the binding for the key used asdictionary-value is invoked instead. This is useful for globalremappings of keys, for example to map Ctrl-[ to Escape. Note that whena key is bound (via bindings.default orbindings.commands), the mapping is ignored.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.loadAutoconfig
options.description: Load settings configured via the GUI.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.quickmarks
options.description: Quickmarks to add to qutebrowser’s quickmarks file.Note that when Home Manager manages your quickmarks, you cannot edit them at runtime.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.searchEngines
options.description: Search engines that can be used via the address bar. Maps a searchengine name (such as DEFAULT, orddg) to a URL with a {}placeholder. The placeholder will be replaced by the search term, use{{ and }} for literal{/} signs. The search engine namedDEFAULT is used whenurl.auto_search is turned on and something else thana URL was entered to be opened. Other search engines can be used byprepending the search engine name to the search term, for example:open google qutebrowser.

options.example: menu = { executable = "${pkgs.wofi}/bin/wofi"; args = [ "--show=dmenu" "--allow-markup" "--allow-images" "--insensitive" "--cache-file=/dev/null" "--parse-search" "--height=40%" "--prompt={prompt}" ];};format = { output_format = "{indent}Output {name} ({id})"; workspace_format = "{indent}Workspace {name} [{layout}] on output {output_name} ({id})"; container_format = "{indent}Container [{layout}] {marks} on workspace {workspace_name} ({id})"; window_format = "img:{app_icon}:text:{indent}{app_name} — {urgency_start}“{title}”{urgency_end} {marks} on workspace {workspace_name} / {output_name} ({id})"; indent = " "; urgency_start = ""; urgency_end = ""; html_escape = true;};layout = { auto_tile = false; auto_tile_min_window_width_per_output_width = [ [ 800 400 ] [ 1024 500 ] [ 1280 600 ] [ 1400 680 ] [ 1440 700 ] [ 1600 780 ] [ 1680 780 ] [ 1920 920 ] [ 2048 980 ] [ 2560 1000 ] [ 3440 1200 ] [ 3840 1280 ] [ 4096 1400 ] [ 4480 1600 ] [ 7680 2400 ] ];};focus = { lockin_delay = 750;};misc = { seq_inhibit = false;};

options.title: programs.watson.enable
options.description: Whether to enable watson, a wonderful CLI to track your time.

options.title: programs.watson.enableBashIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable watson’s bash integration.

options.title: programs.watson.enableFishIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable watson’s fish integration.

options.description: Whether to enable watson’s zsh integration.

options.title: programs.watson.package
options.description: Package providing the watson.

options.title: programs.watson.settings
options.description: Configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/watson/config on Linux or$HOME/Library/Application Support/watson/config on Darwin.
options.note: See https://github.com/TailorDev/Watson/blob/master/docs/user-guide/configuration.mdfor an example configuration.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: {  backend = {    url = "https://api.crick.fr";    token = "yourapitoken";  };  options = {    stop_on_start = true;    stop_on_restart = false;    date_format = "%Y.%m.%d";    time_format = "%H:%M:%S%z";    week_start = "monday";    log_current = false;    pager = true;    report_current = false;    reverse_log = true;  };}

options.title: programs.waybar.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Waybar.

options.title: programs.waybar.package
options.description: Waybar package to use. Set to null to use the default package.

options.title: programs.waybar.settings
options.description: Configuration for Waybar, see https://github.com/Alexays/Waybar/wiki/Configurationfor supported values.
options.type: (list of (JSON value)) or attribute set of (JSON value)
options.example: {  mainBar = {    layer = "top";    position = "top";    height = 30;    output = [      "eDP-1"      "HDMI-A-1"    ];    modules-left = [ "sway/workspaces" "sway/mode" "wlr/taskbar" ];    modules-center = [ "sway/window" "custom/hello-from-waybar" ];    modules-right = [ "mpd" "custom/mymodule#with-css-id" "temperature" ];    "sway/workspaces" = {      disable-scroll = true;      all-outputs = true;    };    "custom/hello-from-waybar" = {      format = "hello {}";      max-length = 40;      interval = "once";      exec = pkgs.writeShellScript "hello-from-waybar" ''        echo "from within waybar"      '';    };  };}

options.title: programs.waybar.style
options.description: CSS style of the bar.
options.note: See https://github.com/Alexays/Waybar/wiki/Configurationfor the documentation.
options.type: null or path or strings concatenated with “\n”
options.example: ''  * {    border: none;    border-radius: 0;    font-family: Source Code Pro;  }  window#waybar {    background: #16191C;    color: #AAB2BF;  }  #workspaces button {    padding: 0 5px;  }''

options.title: programs.waybar.systemd.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Waybar systemd integration.

options.title: programs.waybar.systemd.target
options.description: The systemd target that will automatically start the Waybar service.
options.note: When setting this value to "sway-session.target",make sure to also enable wayland.windowManager.sway.systemd.enable,otherwise the service may never be started.

Seehttps://wezfurlong.org/wezterm/config/appearance.html#defining-a-color-scheme-in-a-separate-filefor more details of the TOML color scheme format.
options.example: myCoolTheme = {  ansi = [    "#222222" "#D14949" "#48874F" "#AFA75A"    "#599797" "#8F6089" "#5C9FA8" "#8C8C8C"  ];  brights = [    "#444444" "#FF6D6D" "#89FF95" "#FFF484"    "#97DDFF" "#FDAAF2" "#85F5DA" "#E9E9E9"  ];  background = "#1B1B1B";  cursor_bg = "#BEAF8A";  cursor_border = "#BEAF8A";  cursor_fg = "#1B1B1B";  foreground = "#BEAF8A";  selection_bg = "#444444";  selection_fg = "#E9E9E9";};

options.title: programs.wezterm.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/wezterm/wezterm.lua. Seehttps://wezfurlong.org/wezterm/config/files.htmlhow to configure.
options.example: -- Your lua code / config herelocal mylib = require 'mylib';return {  usemylib = mylib.do_fun();  font = wezterm.font("JetBrains Mono"),  font_size = 16.0,  color_scheme = "Tomorrow Night",  hide_tab_bar_if_only_one_tab = true,  default_prog = { "zsh", "--login", "-c", "tmux attach -t dev || tmux new -s dev" },  keys = {    {key="n", mods="SHIFT|CTRL", action="ToggleFullScreen"},  }}

options.example: Config  { font        = "Fira Code"  , borderColor = "#d0d0d0"  , border      = FullB  , borderWidth = 3  , bgColor     = "#222"  , fgColor     = "grey"  , position    = TopSize C 99 30  , commands    =      [ Run Cpu ["-t", "cpu: <fc=#4eb4fa><bar> <total>%</fc>"] 10      , Run Network "enp3s0" ["-S", "True", "-t", "eth: <fc=#4eb4fa><rx></fc>/<fc=#4eb4fa><tx></fc>"] 10      , Run Memory ["-t","mem: <fc=#4eb4fa><usedbar> <usedratio>%</fc>"] 10      , Run Date "date: <fc=#4eb4fa>%a %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S </fc>" "date" 10      , Run StdinReader      ]  , sepChar     = "%"  , alignSep    = "}{"  , template    = "  %StdinReader% | %cpu% | %memory% | %enp3s0%  }{%date%  "  }

options.description: Whether to enable GnuPG private key agent.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableBashIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableExtraSocket
options.description: Whether to enable extra socket of the GnuPG key agent (useful for GPGAgent forwarding).

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableFishIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableScDaemon
options.description: Make use of the scdaemon tool. This option has the effect ofenabling the ability to do smartcard operations. Whendisabled, this option passesdisable-scdaemon setting to gpg-agent.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableSshSupport
options.description: Whether to use the GnuPG key agent for SSH keys.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableZshIntegration
options.description: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.defaultCacheTtl
options.description: Set the time a cache entry is valid to the given number ofseconds.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.defaultCacheTtlSsh
options.description: Set the time a cache entry used for SSH keys is valid to thegiven number of seconds.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines to append to the gpg-agentconfiguration file.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.grabKeyboardAndMouse
options.description: Tell the pinentry to grab the keyboard and mouse. Thisoption should in general be used to avoid X-sniffingattacks. When disabled, this option passesno-grab setting to gpg-agent.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.maxCacheTtl
options.description: Set the maximum time a cache entry is valid to n seconds. After thistime a cache entry will be expired even if it has been accessedrecently or has been set using gpg-preset-passphrase. The default is2 hours (7200 seconds).

options.title: services.gpg-agent.maxCacheTtlSsh
options.description: Set the maximum time a cache entry used for SSH keys is valid to nseconds. After this time a cache entry will be expired even if it hasbeen accessed recently or has been set using gpg-preset-passphrase.The default is 2 hours (7200 seconds).

options.title: services.gpg-agent.pinentryFlavor
options.description: Which pinentry interface to use. If notnull, it setspinentry-program ingpg-agent.conf. Beware thatpinentry-gnome3 may not work on non-Gnomesystems. You can fix it by adding the following to yoursystem configuration:
options.note: services.dbus.packages = [ pkgs.gcr ];

options.title: services.gpg-agent.sshKeys
options.description: Which GPG keys (by keygrip) to expose as SSH keys.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.verbose
options.description: Whether to produce verbose output.

options.title: services.grobi.enable
options.description: Whether to enable the grobi display setup daemon.

options.title: services.grobi.executeAfter
options.description: Commands to be run after an output configuration waschanged. The Nix value declared here will be translated toJSON and written to the execute_after keyin $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/grobi.conf.

options.title: services.grobi.rules
options.description: These are the rules grobi tries to match to the currentoutput configuration. The rules are evaluated top to bottom,the first matching rule is applied and processing stops. Seehttps://github.com/fd0/grobi/blob/master/doc/grobi.conffor more information. The Nix value declared here will betranslated to JSON and written to the ruleskey in $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/grobi.conf.
options.type: list of attribute set of (string or boolean or signed integer or list of string)
options.example: [  {    name = "Home";    outputs_connected = [ "DP-2" ];    configure_single = "DP-2";    primary = true;    atomic = true;    execute_after = [      "${pkgs.xorg.xrandr}/bin/xrandr --dpi 96"      "${pkgs.xmonad-with-packages}/bin/xmonad --restart";    ];  }  {    name = "Mobile";    outputs_disconnected = [ "DP-2" ];    configure_single = "eDP-1";    primary = true;    atomic = true;    execute_after = [      "${pkgs.xorg.xrandr}/bin/xrandr --dpi 120"      "${pkgs.xmonad-with-packages}/bin/xmonad --restart";    ];  }]

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Gromit-MPX annotation tool.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.package
options.description: The gromit-mpx package to use.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.hotKey
options.description: A keysym or raw keycode that toggles the activation state ofgromit-mpx.  Set to null to disable thehotkey in which case you’ll have to activate gromit-mpxmanually using the command line.
options.type: null or string or positive integer, meaning >0

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.opacity
options.description: Opacity of the drawing overlay.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools
options.description: Tool definitions for gromit-mpx to use.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.arrowSize
options.description: If not null, automatically draw an arrowat the end of a stroke with the given size.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.color
options.description: The stroke (or recolor) color of the tool.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.device
options.description: Use this tool with the given xinput device.  The device withthe name default works with any input.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.modifiers
options.description: Only activate this tool if the given modifiers are also active.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.size
options.description: The tool size.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.type
options.description: Which type of tool this is.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.undoKey
options.description: A keysym or raw keycode that causes gromit-mpx to undo thelast stroke.  Use this key along with the shift key to redo anundone stoke.  Set to null to disable theundo hotkey.
options.type: null or string or positive integer, meaning >0

options.title: services.himalaya-notify.enable
options.description: Whether to enable the Himalaya new emails notifier service.

options.title: services.himalaya-notify.environment
options.description: Extra environment variables to be exported in the service.

options.title: services.himalaya-notify.settings.account
options.description: Name of the account the notifier should be started for. Ifno account is given, the default one is used.

options.title: services.himalaya-notify.settings.keepalive
options.description: Notifier lifetime of the IDLE session (in seconds).

options.description: Name of the account the watcher should be started for. Ifno account is given, the default one is used.

options.title: services.himalaya-watch.settings.keepalive
options.description: Watcher lifetime of the IDLE session (in seconds).

options.title: services.home-manager.autoUpgrade.enable
options.description: Whether to enable the Home Manager upgrade service that periodically updates your Nixchannels before running home-manager switch.

options.title: services.home-manager.autoUpgrade.frequency
options.description: The interval at which the Home Manager auto upgrade is run.This value is passed to the systemd timer configurationas the OnCalendar option.The format is described insystemd.time(7).

options.title: services.hound.enable
options.description: Whether to enable hound.

options.title: services.hound.databasePath
options.description: The Hound database path.

options.title: services.hound.listenAddress
options.description: Listen address of the Hound daemon.

options.title: services.hound.maxConcurrentIndexers
options.description: Limit the amount of concurrent indexers.

options.title: services.hound.repositories
options.description: The repository configuration.

options.title: services.imapnotify.enable
options.description: Whether to enable imapnotify.

options.title: services.imapnotify.package
options.description: The imapnotify package to use

options.title: services.kanshi.enable
options.description: Whether to enable kanshi, a Wayland daemon that automatically configures outputs.

options.title: services.kanshi.package
options.description: kanshi derivation to use.

options.title: services.kanshi.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines to append to the kanshiconfiguration file.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles
options.description: List of profiles.
options.example: undocked = {  outputs = [    {      criteria = "eDP-1";    }  ];};docked = {  outputs = [    {      criteria = "eDP-1";    }    {      criteria = "Some Company ASDF 4242";      transform = "90";    }  ];};

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.exec
options.description: Commands executed after the profile is successfully applied.Note that if you provide multiple commands, they will beexecuted asynchronously with no guaranteed ordering.
options.type: (list of string) or string convertible to it

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs
options.description: Outputs configuration.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.adaptiveSync
options.description: Enables or disables adaptive synchronization(aka. Variable Refresh Rate).

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.criteria
options.description: The criteria can either be an output name, an output description or “*”.The latter can be used to match any output.
options.note: Onsway(1),output names and descriptions can be obtained viaswaymsg -t get_outputs.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.mode
options.description: <width>x<height>[@<rate>[Hz]]
options.note: Configures the specified output to use the specified mode.Modes are a combination of width and height (in pixels) anda refresh rate (in Hz) that your display can be configured to use.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.position
options.note: Places the output at the specified position in the global coordinatesspace.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.scale
options.description: Scales the output by the specified scale factor.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.status
options.description: Enables or disables the specified output.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.transform
options.description: Sets the output transform.

options.title: services.kanshi.systemdTarget
options.description: Systemd target to bind to.

options.title: services.kbfs.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Keybase File System.

options.title: services.kbfs.extraFlags
options.description: Additional flags to pass to the Keybase filesystem on launch.

options.title: services.kbfs.mountPoint
options.description: Mount point for the Keybase filesystem, relative toHOME.

options.description: Whether to enable KDE connect.

options.description: Whether to enable kdeconnect-indicator service.

options.description: Whether to enable the KeePassX password manager.

options.description: Whether to enable Keybase.

options.title: services.keynav.enable
options.description: Whether to enable keynav.

options.description: Whether to enable lieer Gmail synchronization service.

options.description: Whether to enable listenbrainz-mpd.

options.description: The listenbrainz-mpd package to use.

options.title: services.listenbrainz-mpd.settings
options.description: Configuration for listenbrainz-mpd written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/listenbrainz-mpd/config.toml.

options.title: services.lorri.enable
options.description: Whether to enable lorri build daemon.

options.title: services.lorri.enableNotifications
options.description: Whether to enable lorri build notifications.

options.title: services.lorri.package
options.description: Which lorri package to install.

options.title: services.lorri.nixPackage
options.description: Which nix package to use.

options.title: services.mako.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Mako, lightweight notification daemon for Wayland.

options.title: services.mako.package
options.description: The mako package to use.

options.title: services.mako.actions
options.description: Applications may request an action to be associated with activating anotification. Disabling this will cause mako to ignore these requests.

options.title: services.mako.anchor
options.description: Show notifications at the specified position on the output.Supported values are top-right, top-center, top-left, bottom-right,bottom-center, bottom-left, and center.

options.title: services.mako.backgroundColor
options.description: Set popup background color to a specific color, represented in hexcolor code.

options.title: services.mako.borderColor
options.description: Set popup border color to a specific color, represented in hex colorcode.

options.title: services.mako.borderRadius
options.description: Set popup corner radius to the specified number of pixels.

options.title: services.mako.borderSize
options.description: Set popup border size to the specified number of pixels.

options.title: services.mako.defaultTimeout
options.description: Set the default timeout to timeout in milliseconds. To disable thetimeout, set it to zero.

options.title: services.mako.extraConfig
options.description: Additional configuration.

options.title: services.mako.font
options.description: Font to use, in Pango format.

options.title: services.mako.format
options.description: Set notification format string to format. See FORMAT SPECIFIERS formore information. To change this for grouped notifications, set itwithin a grouped criteria.

options.title: services.mako.groupBy
options.description: A comma-separated list of criteria fields that will be compared toother visible notifications to determine if this one should form agroup with them. All listed criteria must be exactly equal for twonotifications to group.

options.title: services.mako.height
options.description: Set maximum height of notification popups. Notifications whose texttakes up less space are shrunk to fit.

options.title: services.mako.iconPath
options.description: Paths to search for icons when a notification specifies a nameinstead of a full path. Colon-delimited. This approximates the searchalgorithm used by the XDG Icon Theme Specification, but does notsupport any of the theme metadata. Therefore, if you want to searchparent themes, you’ll need to add them to the path manually.
options.note: The /usr/share/icons/hicolor and/usr/share/pixmaps directories arealways searched.

options.title: services.mako.icons
options.description: Whether or not to show icons in notifications.

options.title: services.mako.ignoreTimeout
options.description: If set, mako will ignore the expire timeout sent by notificationsand use the one provided by default-timeout instead.

options.title: services.mako.layer
options.description: Arrange mako at the specified layer, relative to normal windows.Supported values are background, bottom, top, and overlay. Usingoverlay will cause notifications to be displayed above fullscreenwindows, though this may also occur at top depending on yourcompositor.

options.title: services.mako.margin
options.description: Set margin of each edge specified in pixels. Specify single value toapply margin on all sides. Two comma-separated values will setvertical and horizontal edges separately. Four comma-separated willgive each edge a separate value.For example: 10,20,5 will set top margin to 10, left and right to 20and bottom to five.

options.title: services.mako.markup
options.description: If 1, enable Pango markup. If 0, disable Pango markup. If enabled,Pango markup will be interpreted in your format specifier and in thebody of notifications.

options.title: services.mako.maxIconSize
options.description: Set maximum icon size to the specified number of pixels.

options.title: services.mako.maxVisible
options.description: Set maximum number of visible notifications. Set -1 to show all.

options.title: services.mako.output
options.description: Show notifications on the specified output. If empty, notificationswill appear on the focused output. Requires the compositor to supportthe Wayland protocol xdg-output-unstable-v1 version 2.

options.title: services.mako.padding
options.description: Set padding of each edge specified in pixels. Specify single value toapply margin on all sides. Two comma-separated values will setvertical and horizontal edges separately. Four comma-separated willgive each edge a separate value.For example: 10,20,5 will set top margin to 10, left and right to 20and bottom to five.

options.title: services.mako.progressColor
options.description: Set popup progress indicator color to a specific color,represented in hex color code. To draw the progressindicator on top of the background color, use theover attribute. To replace the backgroundcolor, use the source attribute (this canbe useful when the notification is semi-transparent).

options.title: services.mako.sort
options.description: Sorts incoming notifications by time and/or priority in ascending(+)or descending(-) order.

options.title: services.mako.textColor
options.description: Set popup text color to a specific color, represented in hex colorcode.

options.title: services.mako.width
options.description: Set width of notification popups in specified number of pixels.

options.title: services.mbsync.enable
options.description: Whether to enable mbsync.

options.title: services.mbsync.package
options.description: The package to use for the mbsync binary.

options.title: services.mbsync.configFile
options.description: Optional configuration file to link to use instead ofthe default file (~/.mbsyncrc).

options.title: services.mbsync.frequency
options.description: How often to run mbsync.  This value is passed to the systemdtimer configuration as the onCalendar option.  Seesystemd.time(7)for more information about the format.

options.title: services.mbsync.postExec
options.description: An optional command to run after mbsync executes successfully.This is useful for running mailbox indexing tools.

options.title: services.mbsync.preExec
options.description: An optional command to run before mbsync executes.  This isuseful for creating the directories mbsync is going to use.

options.title: services.mbsync.verbose
options.description: Whether mbsync should produce verbose output.

options.title: services.megasync.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Megasync client.

options.title: services.megasync.package
options.description: The megasync package to use.

options.title: services.mopidy.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Mopidy music player daemon.

options.title: services.mopidy.extensionPackages
options.description: Mopidy extensions that should be loaded by the service.

options.title: services.mopidy.extraConfigFiles
options.description: Extra configuration files read by Mopidy when the service starts.Later files in the list override earlier configuration files andstructured settings.

options.title: services.mopidy.settings
options.description: Configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mopidy/mopidy.conf.
options.note: See https://docs.mopidy.com/en/latest/config/ formore details.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (Mopidy config value)
options.example: {  file = {    media_dirs = [      "$XDG_MUSIC_DIR|Music"      "~/library|Library"    ];    follow_symlinks = true;    excluded_file_extensions = [      ".html"      ".zip"      ".jpg"      ".jpeg"      ".png"    ];  };  # Please don't put your mopidy-spotify configuration in the public. :)  # Think of your Spotify Premium subscription!  spotify = {    client_id = "CLIENT_ID";    client_secret = "CLIENT_SECRET";  };}

options.title: services.mpd.enable
options.description: Whether to enable MPD, the music player daemon.

options.title: services.mpd.package
options.description: The MPD package to run.

options.title: services.mpd.dataDir
options.description: The directory where MPD stores its state, tag cache,playlists etc.

options.title: services.mpd.dbFile
options.description: The path to MPD’s database. If set tonull the parameter is omitted from theconfiguration.

options.title: services.mpd.extraArgs
options.description: Extra command-line arguments to pass to MPD.

options.title: services.mpd.extraConfig
options.description: Extra directives added to to the end of MPD’s configurationfile, mpd.conf. Basic configurationlike file location and uid/gid is added automatically to thebeginning of the file. For available options seempd.conf(5).

options.title: services.mpd.musicDirectory
options.description: The directory where mpd reads music from.
options.note: If xdg.userDirs.enable istrue then the defined XDG music directory is used.Otherwise, you must explicitly specify a value.

options.title: services.mpd.network.listenAddress
options.description: The address for the daemon to listen on.Use any to listen on all addresses.

options.title: services.mpd.network.port
options.description: The TCP port on which the the daemon will listen.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.mpd.network.startWhenNeeded
options.description: Enable systemd socket activation.

options.title: services.mpd.playlistDirectory
options.description: The directory where mpd stores playlists.

options.description: Whether to enable the mpd-discord-rpc service.

options.title: services.mpd-discord-rpc.settings

options.description: The network used to dial to the MPD server. Checkhttps://golang.org/pkg/net/#Dialfor available values (most common are “tcp” and “unix”)

options.title: services.mpd-mpris.mpd.password

options.title: services.mpd-mpris.mpd.port

options.title: services.mpd-mpris.mpd.useLocal
options.description: Whether to configure for the local MPD daemon. Iftrue the network,host, and portsettings are ignored.

options.description: The address where MPD is listening for connections.

options.description: If set, mpDris2 will use this directory to access music artwork.

options.title: services.mpdris2.mpd.password
options.description: The password to connect to MPD.

options.title: services.mpdris2.mpd.port

options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.mpdris2.multimediaKeys
options.description: Whether to enable multimedia key support.

options.title: services.mpdris2.notifications
options.description: Whether to enable song change notifications.

options.title: services.mpris-proxy.enable
options.description: Whether to enable a proxy forwarding Bluetooth MIDI controls via MPRIS2 to control media players.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes
options.description: Muchsync remotes to synchronise with.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.frequency
options.description: How often to run muchsync. Thisvalue is passed to the systemd timer configuration as theOnCalendar option. Seesystemd.time(7)for more information about the format.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.local.checkForModifiedFiles
options.description: Check for locally modified files.Without this option, muchsync assumes that files in a maildir arenever edited.
options.note: checkForModifiedFiles disables certainoptimizations so as to make muchsync at least check the timestamp onevery file, which will detect modified files at the cost of a longerstartup time.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.local.importNew
options.description: Whether to begin the synchronisation by runningnotmuch new locally.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.checkForModifiedFiles
options.description: Check for modified files on the remote side.Without this option, muchsync assumes that files in a maildir arenever edited.
options.note: checkForModifiedFiles disables certainoptimizations so as to make muchsync at least check the timestamp onevery file, which will detect modified files at the cost of a longerstartup time.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.host
options.description: Remote SSH host to synchronize with.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.importNew
options.description: Whether to begin the synchronisation by runningnotmuch new on the remote side.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.muchsyncPath
options.description: Specifies the path to muchsync on the server.Ordinarily, muchsync should be in the default PATH on the serverso this option is not required.However, this option is useful if you have to install muchsync ina non-standard place or wish to test development versions of thecode.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.sshCommand
options.description: Specifies a command line to pass to /bin/shto execute a command on another machine.
options.note: Note that because this string is passed to the shell,special characters including spaces may need to be escaped.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.upload
options.description: Whether to propagate local changes to the remote.

options.title: services.pasystray.enable

options.title: services.pbgopy.enable

options.example: {  adaptive_transcode = false;  allow_http = false;  always_transcode = false;  audio_ac3passthrough = false;  audio_dtspassthrough = false;  auto_play = true;  auto_transcode = true;}

options.title: services.polybar.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Polybar status bar.

options.title: services.polybar.package
options.description: Polybar package to install.
options.example: pkgs.polybar.override {  i3GapsSupport = true;  alsaSupport = true;  iwSupport = true;  githubSupport = true;}

options.title: services.polybar.config
options.description: Polybar configuration. Can be either path to a file, or set of attributesthat will be used to create the final configuration.See also services.polybar.settings for a more nix-friendly format.
options.type: (attribute set of attribute set of (string or boolean or signed integer or list of string)) or path convertible to it
options.example: {  "bar/top" = {    monitor = "\${env:MONITOR:eDP1}";    width = "100%";    height = "3%";    radius = 0;    modules-center = "date";  };  "module/date" = {    type = "internal/date";    internal = 5;    date = "%d.%m.%y";    time = "%H:%M";    label = "%time%  %date%";  };}

options.title: services.polybar.extraConfig
options.description: Additional configuration to add.
options.example: ''  [module/date]  type = internal/date  interval = 5  date = "%d.%m.%y"  time = %H:%M  format-prefix-foreground = \''${colors.foreground-alt}  label = %time%  %date%''

options.title: services.polybar.script
options.description: This script will be used to start the polybars.Set all necessary environment variables here and start all bars.It can be assumed that polybar executable is in the PATH.
options.note: Note, this script must start all bars in the background and then terminate.

options.title: services.polybar.settings
options.description: Polybar configuration. This takes a nix attrset and converts it to thestrange data format that polybar uses.Each entry will be converted to a section in the output file.Several things are treated specially: nested keys are convertedto dash-separated keys; the special text key is ignored as a nested key,to allow mixing different levels of nesting; and lists are converted topolybar’s foo-0, foo-1, ... format.
options.note: For example:
options.example: {  "module/volume" = {    type = "internal/pulseaudio";    format.volume = "<ramp-volume> <label-volume>";    label.muted.text = "🔇";    label.muted.foreground = "#666";    ramp.volume = ["🔈" "🔉" "🔊"];    click.right = "pavucontrol &";  };}

options.title: services.xcape.enable

options.title: services.xcape.mapExpression
options.description: The value has the grammar Key[|OtherKey].
options.note: The list of key names is found in the header fileX11/keysymdef.h (remove theXK_ prefix). Note that due to limitationsof X11 shifted keys must be specified as a shift keyfollowed by the key to be pressed rather than the actualname of the character. For example to generate “{” theexpression Shift_L|bracketleft could beused (assuming that you have a key with “{” above “[”).

options.title: services.xcape.timeout

options.title: services.xidlehook.not-when-audio

options.title: services.xidlehook.not-when-fullscreen

options.title: services.xidlehook.once

options.title: services.xidlehook.timers
options.description: A set of commands to be executed after a specific idle timeout.The commands specified in command and cancellerare passed escaped to the script.To use or re-use environment variables that are script-dependent, specify themin the environment section.
options.example: [  {    delay = 60;    command = "xrandr --output \"$PRIMARY_DISPLAY\" --brightness .1";    canceller = "xrandr --output \"$PRIMARY_DISPLAY\" --brightness 1";  }  {    delay = 120;    command = "${pkgs.writeShellScript "my-script" ''      # A complex script to run    ''}";  }]

options.title: services.xidlehook.timers.*.canceller
options.description: Command executed when the user becomes active again.This is only executed if the next timer has not been reached.Path to executables are accepted.The command is automatically escaped.

options.title: services.xidlehook.timers.*.command
options.description: Command executed after the idle timeout is reached.Path to executables are accepted.The command is automatically escaped.

options.title: services.xidlehook.timers.*.delay
options.description: Time before executing the command.

options.description: Whether new or changed services that are wanted by active targetsshould be started. Additionally, stop obsolete services from theprevious generation.
options.note: The alternatives are

options.description: Use a very simple shell script to print suggestedsystemctl commands to run. You will have tomanually run those commands after the switch.
Use a Ruby script to, in a more robust fashion, determine thenecessary changes and automatically run thesystemctl commands.

Use sd-switch, a third party application, to perform the serviceupdates. This tool offers more features while having a smallclosure size. Note, it requires a fully functional user D-Bussession. Once tested and deemed sufficiently robust, this willbecome the default.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.extraConfig

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.extraOptions
options.description: Command line arguments passed to launch Sway. Please DO NOT reportissues if you use an unsupported GPU (proprietary drivers).

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.extraSessionCommands
options.description: Shell commands executed just before Sway is started.
options.example: ''  export SDL_VIDEODRIVER=wayland  # needs qt5.qtwayland in systemPackages  export QT_QPA_PLATFORM=wayland  export QT_WAYLAND_DISABLE_WINDOWDECORATION="1"  # Fix for some Java AWT applications (e.g. Android Studio),  # use this if they aren't displayed properly:  export _JAVA_AWT_WM_NONREPARENTING=1''

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.swaynag.enable
options.description: Whether to enable configuration of swaynag, a lightweight error bar for sway.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.swaynag.settings
options.description: Configuration written to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/swaynag/config.
options.note: Seeswaynag(5)for a list of available options and an example configuration.Note, configurations declared under <config>will override the default type values of swaynag.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (Swaynag config atom (null, bool, int, float, str))
options.example: {  "<config>" = {    edge = "bottom";    font = "Dina 12";  };  green = {    edge = "top";    background = "00AA00";    text = "FFFFFF";    button-background = "00CC00";    message-padding = 10;  };}

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.systemd.enable
options.description: Whether to enable sway-session.target onsway startup. This links tographical-session.target.Some important environment variables will be imported to systemdand dbus user environment before reaching the target, including

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.systemd.xdgAutostart

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.wrapperFeatures.gtk

options.title: xdg.enable
options.description: Whether to enable management of XDG base directories.

options.title: xdg.cacheHome
options.description: Absolute path to directory holding application caches.

options.title: xdg.configFile
options.description: Attribute set of files to link into the user’s XDGconfiguration home.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.enable
options.description: Whether this file should be generated. This option allows specificfiles to be disabled.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.executable
options.description: Set the execute bit. If null, defaults to the modeof the source file or to falsefor files created through the text option.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.onChange
options.description: Shell commands to run when file has changed betweengenerations. The script will be runafter the new files have been linkedinto place.
options.note: Note, this code is always run when recursive isenabled.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.recursive
options.description: If the file source is a directory, then this optiondetermines whether the directory should be recursivelylinked to the target location. This option has no effectif the source is a file.
options.note: If false (the default) then the targetwill be a symbolic link to the source directory. Iftrue then the target will be adirectory structure matching the source’s but whose leafsare symbolic links to the files of the source directory.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.source
options.description: Path of the source file or directory. Ifxdg.configFile.<name>.textis non-null then this option will automatically point to a filecontaining that text.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.target
options.description: Path to target file relative to xdg.configHome.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.text
options.description: Text of the file. If this option is null thenxdg.configFile.<name>.sourcemust be set.

options.title: xdg.configHome
options.description: Absolute path to directory holding application configurations.

options.title: xdg.dataFile
options.description: Attribute set of files to link into the user’s XDGdata home.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.enable
options.description: Whether this file should be generated. This option allows specificfiles to be disabled.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.executable
options.description: Set the execute bit. If null, defaults to the modeof the source file or to falsefor files created through the text option.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.onChange
options.description: Shell commands to run when file has changed betweengenerations. The script will be runafter the new files have been linkedinto place.
options.note: Note, this code is always run when recursive isenabled.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.recursive
options.description: If the file source is a directory, then this optiondetermines whether the directory should be recursivelylinked to the target location. This option has no effectif the source is a file.
options.note: If false (the default) then the targetwill be a symbolic link to the source directory. Iftrue then the target will be adirectory structure matching the source’s but whose leafsare symbolic links to the files of the source directory.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.source
options.description: Path of the source file or directory. Ifxdg.dataFile.<name>.textis non-null then this option will automatically point to a filecontaining that text.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.target
options.description: Path to target file relative to <varname>xdg.dataHome</varname>.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.text
options.description: Text of the file. If this option is null thenxdg.dataFile.<name>.sourcemust be set.

options.title: xdg.dataHome
options.description: Absolute path to directory holding application data.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries
options.description: Desktop Entries allow applications to be shown in your desktop environment’s app launcher.
options.note: You can define entries for programs without entries or override existing entries.
options.example: {  firefox = {    name = "Firefox";    genericName = "Web Browser";    exec = "firefox %U";    terminal = false;    categories = [ "Application" "Network" "WebBrowser" ];    mimeType = [ "text/html" "text/xml" ];  };}

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.actions
options.description: The set of actions made available to application launchers.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.actions.<name>.exec
options.description: Program to execute, possibly with arguments.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.actions.<name>.icon
options.description: Icon to display in file manager, menus, etc.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.actions.<name>.name
options.description: Name of the action.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.categories
options.description: Categories in which the entry should be shown in a menu.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.comment
options.description: Tooltip for the entry.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.exec
options.description: Program to execute, possibly with arguments.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.genericName
options.description: Generic name of the application.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.icon
options.description: Icon to display in file manager, menus, etc.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.mimeType
options.description: The MIME type(s) supported by this application.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.name
options.description: Specific name of the application.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.noDisplay
options.description: Means “this application exists, but don’t display it in the menus”.This can be useful to e.g. associate this application with MIME types.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.prefersNonDefaultGPU
options.description: If true, the application prefers to be run on a more powerful discrete GPU if available.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.settings
options.description: Extra key-value pairs to add to the [Desktop Entry] section.This may override other values.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.startupNotify
options.description: If true, it is KNOWN that the application will send a “remove”message when started with the DESKTOP_STARTUP_IDenvironment variable set. If false, it is KNOWN that the applicationdoes not work with startup notification at all.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.terminal
options.description: Whether the program runs in a terminal window.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.type
options.description: The type of the desktop entry.

options.title: xdg.mime.enable
options.description: Whether to install programs and files to support theXDG Shared MIME-info specification and XDG MIME Applicationsspecification athttps://specifications.freedesktop.org/shared-mime-info-spec/shared-mime-info-spec-latest.htmlandhttps://specifications.freedesktop.org/mime-apps-spec/mime-apps-spec-latest.html,respectively.
options.default: true if host platform is Linux, false otherwise

options.title: xdg.mimeApps.enable
options.description: Whether to manage $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mimeapps.list.

options.title: xdg.mimeApps.associations.added

options.title: xdg.mimeApps.associations.removed

options.title: xdg.mimeApps.defaultApplications
options.description: The default application to be used for a given mimetype. Thisis, for instance, the one that will be started whendouble-clicking on a file in a file manager. If theapplication is no longer installed, the next application inthe list is attempted, and so on.
options.type: attribute set of ((list of string) or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)

options.title: xresources.extraConfig
options.description: Additional X server resources contents.If this and all other xresources options arenull, then this feature is disabled and no~/.Xresources link is produced.
options.example: builtins.readFile (    pkgs.fetchFromGitHub {        owner = "solarized";        repo = "xresources";        rev = "025ceddbddf55f2eb4ab40b05889148aab9699fc";        sha256 = "0lxv37gmh38y9d3l8nbnsm1mskcv10g3i83j0kac0a2qmypv1k9f";    } + "/Xresources.dark")

options.title: xresources.path
options.description: Path where Home Manager should link the .Xresources file.

options.title: xresources.properties
options.description: X server resources that should be set.Booleans are formatted as “true” or “false” respectively.List elements are recursively formatted as a string and joined by commas.All other values are directly formatted using builtins.toString.Note, that 2-dimensional lists are not supported and specifying one will throw an exception.If this and all other xresources options arenull, then this feature is disabled and no~/.Xresources link is produced.
options.type: null or (attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string or list of (boolean or signed integer or string)))

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.enable
