options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.package
options.description: The bspwm package to use.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.alwaysResetDesktops
options.description: If set to true, desktops configured in monitors will be resetevery time the config is run.
options.note: If set to false, desktops will only be configured the first time the config is run.This is useful if you want to dynamically add desktops and you don’t want them to be destroyed if youre-run bspwmrc.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.extraConfig
options.description: Additional shell commands to be run at the end of the config file.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.extraConfigEarly
options.description: Like extraConfig, except commands are run at the start of the config file.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.monitors

options.type: attribute set of list of string

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules
options.description: Rule configuration. The keys of the attribute set are the targets of the rules.
options.type: attribute set of (attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string))
options.example: {  "Gimp" = {    desktop = "^8";    state = "floating";    follow = true;  };  "Kupfer.py" = {    focus = true;  };  "Screenkey" = {    manage = false;  };}

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.border
options.description: Whether the node should have border.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.center
options.description: Whether the node will be put in the center, in floating mode.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.desktop
options.description: The desktop where the rule should be applied.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.focus
options.description: Whether the node should gain focus on creation.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.follow
options.description: Whether focus should follow the node when it is moved.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.hidden
options.description: Whether the node should occupy any space.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.layer
options.description: The layer where a new window should spawn.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.locked
options.description: Whether the node should ignore node --closemessages.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.manage
options.description: Whether the window should be managed by bspwm. If false, the windowwill be ignored by bspwm entirely. This is useful for overlay apps,e.g. screenshot tools.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.marked
options.description: Whether the node will be marked for deferred actions.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.monitor
options.description: The monitor where the rule should be applied.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.node
options.description: The node where the rule should be applied.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.private
options.description: Whether the node should stay in the same tiling position and size.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.rectangle
options.description: The node’s geometry, in the format WxH+X+Y.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.splitDir
options.description: The direction where the container is going to be split.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.splitRatio
options.description: The ratio between the new window and the previous existing window inthe desktop.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.state
options.description: The state in which a new window should spawn.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.sticky
options.description: Whether the node should stay on the focused desktop.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.settings
options.description: General settings given to bspc config.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string or list of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string))

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.startupPrograms
options.description: Programs to be executed during startup.

options.example: let  xmonad = pkgs.xmonad-with-packages.override {    packages = self: [ self.xmonad-contrib self.taffybar ];  };in  "${xmonad}/bin/xmonad";

options.title: xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.init
options.description: Init configuration for Fluxbox, written to~/.fluxbox/init. Look at thefluxbox(1) manpage for details.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.keys
options.description: Keyboard shortcuts configuration for Fluxbox, written to~/.fluxbox/keys. Look at thefluxbox-keys(1) manpage for details.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.menu
options.description: Menu configuration for Fluxbox, written to~/.fluxbox/menu. Look at thefluxbox-menu(1) manpage for details.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.slitlist
options.description: Slitlist configuration for Fluxbox, written to~/.fluxbox/slitlist. Look at thefluxbox(1) manpage for details.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.windowmenu
options.description: Window menu configuration for Fluxbox, written to~/.fluxbox/windowmenu. Look at thefluxbox-menu(1)manpage for details.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.enable
options.description: Whether to enable herbstluftwm window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.package
options.description: Package providing the herbstluftwm andherbstclient commands.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines to add verbatim to$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/herbstluftwm/autostart.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.keybinds
options.description: Herbstluftwm keybinds.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.mousebinds
options.description: Herbstluftwm mousebinds.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.rules
options.description: Herbstluftwm rules.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.settings
options.description: Herbstluftwm settings.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.tags
options.description: Tags to create on startup.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.enable
options.description: Whether to enable i3 window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.package
options.description: The i3 package to use.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config
options.description: i3 configuration options.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.assigns
options.description: An attribute set that assigns applications to workspaces basedon criteria.
options.type: attribute set of list of attribute set of (string or boolean)

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars
options.description: i3 bars settings blocks. Set to empty list to remove bars completely.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors
options.description: Bar color settings. All color classes can be specified using submoduleswith ‘border’, ‘background’, ‘text’, fields and RGB color hex-codes as values.See default values for the reference.Note that ‘background’, ‘status’, and ‘separator’ parameters take a single RGB value.
options.note: See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#_colors.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.activeWorkspace
options.description: Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace is active.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.background
options.description: Background color of the bar.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.bindingMode
options.description: Border, background and text color for the binding mode indicator

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.focusedBackground
options.description: Background color of the bar on the currently focused monitor output.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.focusedSeparator
options.description: Text color to be used for the separator on the currently focused monitor output.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.focusedStatusline
options.description: Text color to be used for the statusline on the currently focused monitor output.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.focusedWorkspace
options.description: Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace has focus.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.inactiveWorkspace
options.description: Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace does nothave focus and is not active.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.separator
options.description: Text color to be used for the separator.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.statusline
options.description: Text color to be used for the statusline.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.urgentWorkspace
options.description: Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace containsa window with the urgency hint set.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.command
options.description: Command that will be used to start a bar.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines for this bar.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.fonts
options.description: Font configuration for this bar.
options.example: {  names = [ "DejaVu Sans Mono" "FontAwesome5Free" ];  style = "Bold Semi-Condensed";  size = 11.0;}

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.hiddenState
options.description: The default bar mode when ‘bar.mode’ == ‘hide’.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.id
options.description: Specifies the bar ID for the configured bar instance.If this option is missing, the ID is set to bar-x, where x correspondsto the position of the embedding bar block in the config file.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.mode
options.description: Bar visibility mode.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.position
options.description: The edge of the screen i3bar should show up.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.statusCommand
options.description: Command that will be used to get status lines.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.trayOutput
options.description: Where to output tray.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.trayPadding
options.description: Sets the pixel padding of the system tray.This padding will surround the tray on all sides and between each item.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.workspaceButtons
options.description: Whether workspace buttons should be shown or not.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.workspaceNumbers
options.description: Whether workspace numbers should be displayed within the workspace buttons.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors
options.description: Color settings. All color classes can be specified using submoduleswith ‘border’, ‘background’, ‘text’, ‘indicator’ and ‘childBorder’ fieldsand RGB color hex-codes as values. See default values for the reference.Note that ‘i3.config.colors.background’ parameter takes a single RGB value.
options.note: See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#_changing_colors.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.background
options.description: Background color of the window. Only applications which do not coverthe whole area expose the color.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.focused
options.description: A window which currently has the focus.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.focusedInactive
options.description: A window which is the focused one of its container,but it does not have the focus at the moment.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.placeholder
options.description: Background and text color are used to draw placeholder windowcontents (when restoring layouts). Border and indicator are ignored.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.unfocused
options.description: A window which is not focused.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.urgent
options.description: A window which has its urgency hint activated.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.defaultWorkspace
options.description: The default workspace to show when i3 is launched.This must to correspond to the value of the keybinding of the default workspace.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating
options.description: Floating window settings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating.border
options.description: Floating windows border width.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating.criteria
options.description: List of criteria for windows that should be opened in a floating mode.
options.type: list of attribute set of (string or boolean)

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating.modifier
options.description: Modifier key or keys that can be used to drag floating windows.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating.titlebar
options.description: Whether to show floating window titlebars.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus
options.description: Focus related settings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.followMouse
options.description: Whether focus should follow the mouse.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.forceWrapping
options.description: Whether to force focus wrapping in tabbed or stacked containers.
options.note: This option is deprecated, use focus.wrapping instead.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.mouseWarping
options.description: Whether mouse cursor should be warped to the center of the window when switching focusto a window on a different output.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.newWindow
options.description: This option modifies focus behavior on new window activation.
options.note: See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#focus_on_window_activation

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.wrapping
options.description: Whether the window focus commands automatically wrap around the edge of containers.
options.note: See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#_focus_wrapping

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.fonts
options.description: Font configuration for window titles, nagbar…
options.example: {  names = [ "DejaVu Sans Mono" "FontAwesome5Free" ];  style = "Bold Semi-Condensed";  size = 11.0;}

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps
options.description: Gaps related settings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.bottom
options.description: Bottom gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.horizontal
options.description: Horizontal gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.inner
options.description: Inner gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.left
options.description: Left gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.outer
options.description: Outer gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.right
options.description: Right gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.smartBorders
options.description: This option controls whether to disable container borders onworkspace with a single container.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.smartGaps
options.description: This option controls whether to disable all gaps (outer and inner)on workspace with a single container.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.top
options.description: Top gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.vertical
options.description: Vertical gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.keybindings
options.description: An attribute set that assigns a key press to an action using a key symbol.See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#keybindings.
options.note: Consider to use lib.mkOptionDefault function to extend or overridedefault keybindings instead of specifying all of them from scratch.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.keycodebindings
options.description: An attribute set that assigns keypress to an action using key code.See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#keybindings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.menu
options.description: Default launcher to use.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.modes
options.description: An attribute set that defines binding modes and keybindingsinside them
options.note: Only basic keybinding is supported (bindsym keycomb action),for more advanced setup use ‘i3.extraConfig’.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of string

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.modifier
options.description: Modifier key that is used for all default keybindings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup
options.description: Commands that should be executed at startup.
options.note: See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#_automatically_starting_applications_on_i3_startup.
options.example: [{ command = "systemctl --user restart polybar"; always = true; notification = false; }{ command = "dropbox start"; notification = false; }{ command = "firefox"; }];

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup.*.always
options.description: Whether to run command on each i3 restart.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup.*.command
options.description: Command that will be executed on startup.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup.*.notification
options.description: Whether to enable startup-notification support for the command.See --no-startup-id option description in the i3 user guide.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup.*.workspace
options.description: Launch application on a particular workspace. DEPRECATED:Use xsession.windowManager.i3.config.assignsinstead. See https://github.com/nix-community/home-manager/issues/265.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.terminal
options.description: Default terminal to run.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window
options.description: Window titlebar and border settings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.border
options.description: Window border width.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.commands
options.description: List of commands that should be executed on specific windows.See for_window i3wm option documentation.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.commands.*.command
options.description: i3wm command to execute.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.commands.*.criteria
options.description: Criteria of the windows on which command should be executed.
options.note: A value of true is equivalent to using an emptycriteria (which is different from an empty string criteria).

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.hideEdgeBorders
options.description: Hide window borders adjacent to the screen edges.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.titlebar
options.description: Whether to show window titlebars.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceAutoBackAndForth
options.description: Assume you are on workspace “1: www” and switch to “2: IM” usingmod+2 because somebody sent you a message. You don’t need to rememberwhere you came from now, you can just press $mod+2 again to switchback to “1: www”.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceLayout
options.description: The mode in which new containers on workspace level willstart.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceOutputAssign
options.description: Assign workspaces to outputs.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceOutputAssign.*.output
options.description: Name(s) of the output(s) from    i3-msg -t get_outputs .

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceOutputAssign.*.workspace
options.description: Name of the workspace to assign.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.extraConfig
options.description: Extra configuration lines to add to ~/.config/i3/config.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.enable
options.description: Whether to enable Spectrwm window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.package
options.description: Package providing the spectrwm command.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.bindings
options.description: Spectrwm keybindings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.programs
options.description: Spectrwm programs variables.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.quirks
options.description: Spectrwm quicks (custom window rules).

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.settings
options.description: Spectrwm settings.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.unbindings
options.description: List of keybindings to disable from default Spectrwm configuration.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.enable
options.description: Whether to enable xmonad window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.enableContribAndExtras
options.description: Enable xmonad-{contrib,extras} in xmonad.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.config
options.description: The configuration file to be used for xmonad. This must bean absolute path or null in which case~/.xmonad/xmonad.hs will not be managedby Home Manager.
options.note: If this option is set to a non-null value,recompilation of xmonad outside of Home Manager (e.g. viaxmonad --recompile) will fail.
options.example: pkgs.writeText "xmonad.hs" ''  import XMonad  main = xmonad defaultConfig      { terminal    = "urxvt"      , modMask     = mod4Mask      , borderWidth = 3      }''

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.extraPackages
options.description: Extra packages available to GHC when rebuilding xmonad. Thevalue must be a function which receives the attribute setdefined in haskellPackages as the soleargument.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.haskellPackages
options.description: The haskellPackages used to build xmonadand other packages. This can be used to change the GHCversion used to build xmonad and the packages listed inextraPackages.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.libFiles
options.description: Additional files that will be saved in~/.xmonad/lib/ and included in the configurationbuild. The keys are the file names while the values are paths to thecontents of the files.
